Nicolas C. is 51 years old and has been married for 25 years with his wife Bernandina. They have seven children, four of whom are already grown and live on their own. Three children, ages 7, 9 and 13, still live with Nicolas and his wife and are currently going to school. 

Nicolas comes from a humble family and is dedicated to his work. For 11 years now he has been buying and selling logs to local sawmills and has all the documents and permits required, for example transportation and environmental impact. He has a 20-hectare property (49.5 acres) that he also uses to cut trees and sell wood logs in the city. 

Nicolas is requesting this loan so he can buy more logs from other people and transport them to Caaguazu and fulfill all his orders.

loans.use: Logs (wood)

loans.name: Eloyza

texts.es:
Eloyza es una madre de familia de 34 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una zona agrícola caracterizada por tener una geografía accidentada debido a su cercanía con la sierra del país. El lugar se encuentra ubicado a mas de hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir para damas y caballeros en un pequeño establecimiento instalado dentro de su domicilio. Ella adquiere su mercadería en la ciudad de Chiclayo y la ofrece a sus vecinos y conocidos. Adicionalmente cuenta con una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para transportar carga y pasajeros) con la cual brinda servicio de transporte en su localidad.

Eloyza desea implementar su negocio de venta de ropa con la compra de mas mercadería, especialmente de la temporada primavera – verano. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer con muchas ganas de superarse y sacar adelante a los suyos, sus vecinos y conocidos la consideran alguien amable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Eloyza is a 34 year old mother who lives with her husband and two children in the District of Oyotún, an agricultural area known for having rugged terrain due to its proximity to the mountains. This community is located more than an hour and a half away from the city of Chiclayo.

Eloyza sells clothing for women and men from a small establishment set up in her home. She acquires her merchandise in the city of Chiclayo and offers them to her neighbors and acquaintances. In addition, she owns a motorcycle taxi (a motorized vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with an attached cabin for transporting cargo or passengers) with which she provides transportation services within her neighborhood.

Eloyza wants to continue her clothing business by purchasing more merchandise, especially items for the spring and summer seasons. To accomplish her goal, she has decided to apply for her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN.

She is a woman who has great desire to succeed so that her family can move forward. Her neighbors and acquaintances consider her to be someone who is kind and trustworthy.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing for spring and summer

loans.name: Naziran

texts.en:
Naziran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s dairy business.  He wants to improve his milk-selling business by purchasing another buffalo. She lives in a small city, Kasur, famous in Pakistan for its leather industry,  and owns a small house of two rooms in an area named Kullay Walla where she has lived with her family for many years. She is the mother of 5 sons; three of them work and the other two are studying. Her eldest son is a gardener, and the other two works in a factory on monthly wage. 

Naziran is a very caring lady. She prefers to stay at home managing the household chores and taking care of her family. In her spare time she helps her husband by taking care of his buffaloes and milking them as well. With the loan amount her husband will buy another buffalo for his dairy business. Naziran hopes that by purchasing another buffalo, the productivity of milk will ultimately increase which will make her husband more sales and income. 

Naziran has a plan to construct a room in her home for her eldest son because he is nearing marriageable age. She is confident that this will be done soon with the help of loan profits. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In her previous loan years she has always paid her installments on time and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Grisel

texts.es:
Grisel vive en la zona de Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es soltera-estudiante, y solo recibe ayuda de sus padres para poder cancelar sus estudios, 
El crédito será destinado para el pago de estudios, pago de pensiones y elaboración de tesis para licenciatura, en la carrera de Derecho de la Universidad Católica Boliviana.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. 
Con este crédito podrá terminar sus estudios y comenzar a trabajar.
texts.en:
Grisel lives in La Paz’s Irpavi neighborhood.  She is single and a student.  The only support she gets from her parents is tuition costs.

The loan will be used to cover educational expenses: meals and thesis writing costs for graduation in Law at the Boliviana Catholic University.

This is her first loan request to Impro.

This loan will make it possible for her to complete her studies and start to work.

loans.use: To pay for meals and thesis writing costs at the Catholic University of La Paz

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia O. is a married woman who lives in Purok Cosmos, Brgy. Doldol, Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  livestock and farming. Her husband Eliseo, who is 46 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are between 15 and 26 years old.

Cecilia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Cecilia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,200, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,500, which she intends to use for additional capital for her livestock business so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Cecilia O. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her livestock business.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson S. S. is 24, married, and has one child.  His wife is a farmer.  He trades livestock in the Bissil market in Kajiado. He sells his livestock to the Kenya meat commission and to butchers in the area for slaughter. He also supplies his cattle to the Bama Market, which is a large slaughterhouse. He has been running his livestock trading business for five years and he earns a monthly profit of  8,000 KES.

Wilson was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office. With the 30,000 loan KES, Wilson plans to use 20,000 KES to buy cows, 5,000 KES to buy goats, and 5,000 KES to buy sheep, all for trading. If the loan boosts the business, Wilson will buy a pick-up truck for transporting the livestock. Wilson's dream is to specialize in supplying livestock to Dagorreti and Kenya meat commission slaughterhouses. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy livestock for trading

loans.name: Itacuan Group

texts.es:
El siguiente Grupo tiene por nombre “Itacuan”, que significa flor amarilla en la lengua mixteca, se dio este nombre al grupo en honor a la localidad donde habitan sus integrantes, la cruz del itacuan se ubica a 15 minutos de Pinotepa, y la mayoría de sus habitantes hablan la lengua mixteca, también se dedican al trabajo en el campo, a la cría de cabras (chivos). su representante se llama: Francisca Sánchez González, todas las integrantes del grupo dedican su tiempo al empleo personal y a la venta de algunos productos de consumo regional. 
Haremos un espacio para hablar  un poco de la vida de una miembro de este grupo ella es la señora Francisca Sánchez González, quien tiene 39 años de edad, ella es la representante del grupo esta casada con Aron de 40 años, quien es chofer de un taxi del transporte publico, tiene 4 hijos, ellos son: Mirna de 18, Natali de 11, Rafael de 9 y Dalila de 8 años de edad, todos ellos están estudiando actualmente.
Francisca, se dedica a la venta de carne de puerco desde hace mas de 6 años, a ella le gusta su trabajo, a pesar de que apara algunos no sea nada agradable el sacrificar animales, esta es una forma de aportar al gasto familiar y escolar de sus hijos, ella tiene su propio criadero de puercos, que adquiere desde pequeños y se encarga de cuidarlos y alimentarlos hasta que llegan a ser adultos para su venta, ya sea en peso bruto o destazado, esta actividad es poco usual en su comunidad pero se vio en la necesidad de incursionar en esta área, con esta actividad ella puede fomentar el autoconsumo interno de la producción y cría de puercos en la comunidad. Su esposo se dice muy orgulloso de ella y el le ayuda a la cortar la carne y a la elaboración de chicharrón de puerco, para los que no saben que es el chicharrón, es la piel del cerdo mejor conocida como cuero, esta se cocina en grasa hirviendo, hasta llegar al punto de dorarse, es una comida tradicional del pueblo mexicano.
Francisca integro un grupo de crédito, primeramente por su necesidad de un préstamo y la necesidad de sus demás compañeras. Ella utilizo este recurso  para la compra de puercos, el mantenimiento e su corral y para el alimento de los puercos que ella misma esta criando, pudo adquirir mas leña para cocinar el chicharrón, chiles para elaborar chorizo y carne enchilada. 
Uno de sus grandes sueños de Francisca es tener una granja grande de puercos, aumentar sus numero de animales, y así ella podrá dar trabajo a ka gente que habita en esta población para que se desarrollen y puedan progresar ya que los recursos del gobierno están mal invertidos, ella quiere promover la crianza de animales para autoconsumo dentro de la zona, pero para esto se necesita de mas inversión de apoyo por parte de todos y el esfuerzo y compromiso de mas gente que quiera salir adelante, también aspira a tener su propio local comercial para la venta de carne y así como el equipo necesario para facilitar mas su trabajo. También quiere que sus hijos se preparen de manera profesional, que se ganen la vida en oportunidades mejores, y que ellos puedan lograr sus sueños de ellos y de los que los rodean.
Todas las personas que integran este grupo son mujeres muy trabajadoras, llenas de ánimo, son muy alegres y a pesar de la situación en que viven algunas, creen en la realización los sueños y  en la bondad de las demás personas que sirven a los demás, ellas son muy cumplidas con sus compromisos, con sus familias y con su gente, esta es una característica de los indígenas que habitan esta zona de Oaxaca. 
Francisca, esta totalmente agradecida con la nobleza de los que apoyan a los diferentes grupos en el mundo, haciendo así posible los sueños de muchos y mejorando la forma de vivir de los más necesitados. A nombre de las que integran este grupo les manda un fraternal saludo a los que vean esta historia así como una gran abrazo para los que apoye su proyecto.
A continuación aquí se dan a conocer los nombres de las integrantes del grupo “Itacuan” así como sus actividades productivas: 

Heriberta Rafaela R. R.. – Venta de quesos
Emma Sánchez R..- Venta de carne de pollo
Francisca Sánchez González.- Venta de productos para el hogar 
Elizabeth Soledad M. M..-Venta de ropa por catalogo
Carmen C. M..- Venta de comida
Eufemia Inés M. M..- venta de carne de pollo
Araceli R. López.- Venta de pollos
Luisa Sánchez S..- Venta de pollos 
Lucia C. Sánchez.- Venta de ropa
Matilde C. M..- Venta de antojitos
texts.en:
The following group is called "Itacuan", which means yellow flower in the Mixteca language. The group gave itself this name in honour of the locality where the members live. La Cruz de Itacuan is located 15 minutes from Pinotepa and the majority of its inhabitants speak the Mixteca language and work in the countryside raising goats. Their representative is named Francisca Sánchez González, all the members of the group dedicate their time to personal work and the sale of some regionally consumed products. 

We will make space to talk a little about the life of one member of this group. Mrs. Francisca Sánchez González, who is 39 years old, is the representative of the group and is married to Aron, 40 years old, who is a public transport taxi driver. She has 4 children: Mirna, 18; Natali, 11; Rafael 9; and Dalila, 8 years old. They are all currently studying. 

Francisca has sold pork for more than 6 years. She likes her work, even though for some there is nothing pleasant in sacrificing animals, this is a way to contribute to the family expenses and school expenses of her children. She has her own pig farm, which she aquires when they are young and looks after them and feeds them until they are adults to be sold, either by gross weight or cut up. This activity is not very common in her community but she saw the need to enter into this area. With this activity she can boost the internal personal consumption of the production and raising of pigs within the community. Her husband is very proud of her and he helps her to cut the meat and with the production of pork chicharrón. For those who don't know what chicharrón is, it's the skin of the pig, which is cooked in boiling fat until becoming golden. It's a traditional food of the Mexican people.     

Francisca formed a loan group primarily for her need of a loan and the need of her fellow group members. She used this resource for the purchase of pigs, the maintenance of their pen and to feed the pigs which she herself is raising. She was able to acquire more firewood to cook chicharrón, chili peppers to make chorizo and meat seasoned with chili. One of Francisca's biggest dreams is to have a big pig farm, to increase the number of animals, and by this way she will be able to give work to the people who live in this town so that they develop and are able to progress, since government resources are poorly invested. She wants to promote the raising of animals for personal consumption within the zone, but for this it's necessary to have more support investment from everyone and the effort and commitment of more people who want to get ahead. She also aspires to have her own commercial premises for the sale of meat as well as the necessary equipment to further facilitate her work. She also wants her children to prepare themselves professionally, to earn a living with better opportunities, and for them to be able to achieve their dreams and those of those who surround them.    

All the people who make up this group are very hard-working women, full of motivation. They are very happy, and despite the situation in which some of them live, they believe in the fulfillment of their dreams and in the goodness of other people who serve others. They are very fulfilled with their commitments, with their families and with their people. This is a characteristic of the indigenous people who live in this part of Oaxaca.  

Francisca is extremely thankful for the nobility of those who support different groups throughout the world, in this way making possible the dreams of many and improving the lives of those most needy. On behalf of the members of this group, she sends fraternal greetings to whoever sees this story as well as a big hug to those who support her project.

Below are given the names of the members of the "Itacuan" group as well as their production activities: 

Heriberta Rafaela R. R.. – Sale of cheese
Emma Sánchez R..- Sale of chicken
Francisca Sánchez González.- Sale of household products 
Elizabeth Soledad M. M..- Sale of catalogue clothing
Carmen C. M..- Sale of food
Eufemia Inés M. M..- Sale of chicken
Araceli R. López.- Sale of chickens
Luisa Sánchez S..- Sale of chickens
Lucia C. Sánchez.- Sale of clothing
Matilde C. M..- Sale of snacks

loans.use: This loan will be used for the purchase and sale of pork; both for the purchase of more feed for the raising of pigs (piglets), which will be slaughtered and the meat sold, and for the purchase of firewood to prepare chicharron (fried pork).

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda P. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 38 years old, married and has 2 children aged 10 and 2. Gilda owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for breeding. Gilda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

Gilda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Gilda is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional piglets and feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 38-year-old married man and the father of one young child. He is from Lebanon. He has twenty years of experience painting cars. He is the main income provider for his family. He borrowed his first Kiva loan and he was a very reliable client who paid on time during the loan term. He is thankful for the results and today, he is requesting a new loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l.  to increase his inventory of new paints and, therefore, increase his sales. He is optimistic about his business prospects for the coming years.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Teofilo, tiene 29 años, vive junto con su esposa y sus tres hijos, ellos viven en la provincia de Anta distrito de Anta departamento del Cusco.  Anta se encuentra ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Teofilo se dedica a la agricultura, él vende sus productos como por ejemplo papa, zanahorias y maíz en la feria de la comunidad de Inquilpata llamada “Tablada”. La comunidad de Inquilpata se encuentra ubicada a 15 minutos de ciudad principal de Anta. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va excelente gracias al empeño que le pone a su trabajo. Teofilo espera recibir de S/. 1500 nuevos soles de crédito y va comprar semillas, abono y muchas cosas más.

Teofilo pertenece al banco comunal “LLankaq Maqui” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene un año de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Teófilo, 29, lives with his wife and three children in Anta province, Anta district, Cusco department.  Anta is located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco.

Teófilo is a farmer.  He sells his products, potatoes, carrots and corn, at Iquilpata’s market called “Tablada.” Iquilpata is located 15 minutes from the main city of Anta.  He has been in this business for several years now and does excellently thanks to the effort he puts into his work.  Teófilo hopes to get a 1500 new sol loan to buy seeds, manure and many more things.

Teófilo is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “LLankaq Maqui” communal bank which has been in operation for a year and is well run by its board of directors.

loans.use: To buy seeds, manure and many more things.

loans.name: Kholburi

texts.en:
I. Kholburi is 25 years old. He is married with 3 kids. Kholburi is dedicated to his agricultural business. Having little knowledge in the beginning, he had to learn a lot about farming. Now, he has acquired a fair amount of experience in agriculture. Currently, Kholburi is very happy, because of his kids who are the motivation for his desire to grow his business. He approached IMON International to obtain a loan to buy more inputs: seeds and fertilizer to sow for a good harvest so he can take care of his children and his home.     


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos en el caserío Nueva Esperanza en el distrito de Olmos; una zona agrícola situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a mas una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, especialmente ovejas, en un corral situado en su domicilio. Ella los alimenta de pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. Ella adicionalmente se dedica  a la confección de vestidos y blusas; las confecciona para luego vendérselas a sus vecinos,

Alicia desea adquirir ganado ovino y caprino para seguir aumentando su negocio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar nuevamente a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Para Alicia su mayor anhelo sigue siendo sacar adelante a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida, por ello siempre se esfuerza al máximo en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Alicia is a 25-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and children in the Nueva Esperanza hamlet of the Olmos district, an agricultural area situated in the Lambayeque province, located over an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

She raises and sells animals, specifically sheep, in a corral at her place of residence. She feeds them natural pasture, and when they have reached the optimal point in their development, she sells them to traders that frequent the area. She also makes dresses and blouses for a living, which she then sells to her neighbors.

Alicia would like to obtain sheep and goats in order to keep expanding her business. For this reason, she feels that it is appropriate to once again request a 2,000.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

Alicia's biggest wish is to continue helping her family get ahead and improve their quality of life, which is why she always puts the maximum effort in her work.

loans.use: Purchase sheep and goats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Upgrading his banana plantation by buying manure and pesticides for the plantation.

loans.name: Janviere

texts.en: Janviere is 31 years old and has three children between the ages of 1 and 10, two of whom are in school. Janviere’s husband runs a bar and Janviere owns a general store in which she sells Vaseline, sugar, and a variety of foodstuffs. She has had this business for three years. She is requesting a loan to buy additional inventory of the items she sells in her shop. With the profits, she hopes to buy some fabrics for her home, and to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for her shop.

loans.name: Mirley Yaneth

texts.es:
Después de separarse de su esposo, Mirley Yaneth A. C., buscó la manera de cubrir sus gastos, fue entonces cuando decidió montar su propio negocio de venta de helados y así salir adelante. 

Actualmente, Mirley necesita de un préstamo para comprar más productos y así ampliar su oferta y captar más clientes, pues cada vez le piden más variedad. 

En el futuro esta emprendedora sueña con tener una charcutería para aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
After separating from her husband, Mirley Yaneth A. C. looked for a way to cover her expenses.  It was then that she decided to start her own business and sell ice cream so that she could get ahead.

Currently Mirley needs a loan to buy more products and thus enlarge her selection so that she can attract more customers.  They are always asking for a greater variety.

In the future this entrepreneurial woman dreams of having a delicatessen to increase her earnings and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy more food products

loans.name: Elberta

texts.es:
Elberta tiene 55 años, es casada y tiene 8 hijos. Pertenece al Banco Comunal Triunfo II de FINCA Peru.
Solicita un crédito de S/. 3 000.00.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de productos como : arroz , azúcar, aceite, fideos, maíz, todo tipo de carnes, verduras y papas para la preparación de alimentos.
Elberta, está en Finca Perú ya hace 12 años, antes compartía el puesto de comida con su cuñada, gracias a sus ahorros pudo comprarse su propio puesto de venta en el mercado Carlos F. Vivanco de Ayacucho, donde vende todo tipo de caldos como : caldo de cabeza, mondongo, cordero, pata y otros platos como: arroz con pollo, tallarines , puca picante. Trabaja de lunes a domingo, gracias a Dios le va bien.
Le gusta FINCA Peru porque puede ahorrar, les enseñan y practican los valores, le orientan en la educación y cuidado de los hijos y familia.
Ahora esta ahorrando para la construcción de su casa y su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales
texts.en:
Elberta is 55 years old, married, and she has 8 children. She is a member of the communal bank named "Triunfo II" of Finca Peru (Kiva Field Partner). 

She requests a loan in the amount of S/. 3000

The loan which she requests will be used to purchase products such as: rice, sugar, cooking oil, pasta, corn, various types of meats, vegetables, and potatoes, used to prepare foods.

Elberta has been with Finca Peru for the past 12 years. Previously she shared a food stall with her sister-in-law. Thanks to her savings she was able to purchase a stall of her own at the market Carlos F. Vivanco de Ayacucho. She sells all types of soups there, such as: head soup, stomach soup, lamb soup, hoof soup and other dishes, including rice and chicken, pasta, and spiced potatoes. She works from Monday to Sunday and thank God she is very successful. 

She likes Finca Peru because she is able to save money, they teach and practice sound values, and they provide education on child and family care.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Sonia Ysabel

texts.es:
Sonia es una abogada y ofrece dentro de su oficina servicios jurídicos, es soltera pero tiene un hijo, vive en el barrio San Antonio de Pilar, posee casa propia y con ella vive su madre, Sonia es una persona muy activa y trabajadora con muy buenas referencias en su profesión.
Manifiesta que solicita el crédito para poder terminar la remodelación de su oficina, en la cual hizo ya anteriormente algunas modificaciones importantes.
Al mismo tiempo agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por los buenos servicios que le ha brindado al solicitar el préstamo y así también ella promete cumplir en tiempo y forma con el compromiso asumido con la empresa en caso de conseguir el crédito, para que así en un determinado tiempo pueda contar nuevamente con el apoyo de la Institución para cualquier emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Sonia is a lawyer and has an office where she offers legal services. She is single and has a son; she lives in the neighborhood of San Antonio de Pilar in her own house. Sonia's mother lives with her as well.

Sonia is a very active and hardworking person with a very good reputation in her profession. She is asking for a loan in order to finish the renovation of her office where she has already made some important changes. 

At the same time, Sonia would like to thank Fundación Paraguay for the great services that it has provided in the process of applying for the loan and would also like to say that she is very committed to repaying the loan in a timely manner because she hopes to be able to have the support of this institution for future projects.

loans.use: to renovate her office

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson J. is from the village of Libertad, Aurora Zambonga Del Sir. He is 52 years old. Nelson is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Nelson owns and operates a business venture in the services sector providing waste management services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating tricycle transport services. Nelson has been engaged in his business for over 11 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Nelson joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelson is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nelson from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Marc Adékounté

texts.fr: Né le 24 Avril 1972, Marc Adékounté est marié à Félicité, une marchande. Le couple a quatre enfants à charge, dont deux sont les leurs. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Marc Adékounté vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Marc Adékounté subvient ensemble avec sa femme, aux besoins de la famille. Marc Adékounté n’a fréquenté que l’école primaire, mais  a appris la couture, une activité qu’il exerce depuis onze ans et qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. De façon secondaire, Marc Adékounté vend des fournitures de couture dans son atelier. Marc Adékounté s’approvisionne au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Marc Adékounté sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit. Ce crédit lui servira à mieux équiper son atelier de couture à travers l’acquisition d’une machine à broder et des fournitures de couture, et à mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Marc Adékounté was born on April 24, 1972. He is married to Félicité, a merchant. The couple supports four children, of whose two are their own. Some of the children are in school. He lives together with his wife and children. Along with his wife, he meets the needs of the family. 

Marc Adékounté only attended primary school. But he learned how to sew. He has been in this business for eleven years. It enables him to support himself and his children. Secondarily, he sells sewing supplies in his workshop. He gets his supplies from Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin. 

This is the second time that has requested a loan from ALIDé. This loan will serve to better equip his sewing shop by acquiring an embroidery machine and some sewing supplies and to satisfy his customers further.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine and sewing supplies

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is from the town of Barra Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Caroline is single and has two adult children.

Caroline has a general store that sells food & daily use products in her community. Caroline has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 14,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2011, Caroline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Caroline is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like soft drinks and rice for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Caroline from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC: 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like soft drinks and rice for sale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 40 years old, married and blessed with two children who go to school. She operates a green grocery to earn a living. Previously, she was selling secondhand clothes. Margaret’s business is only one year old and she hopes to buy a vehicle for transporting fruits and vegetables. She also dreams of buying a piece of land in the future. She has requested a 10,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy onions.

loans.use: to buy onions.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Rosa has been in this business for 29 years.

She has requested a PHP 18,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell. Rosa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 26 years old and the single mother of one child who is 13 months old. She buys all types of beauty products such as hair products, hair clips and perfumes, which she sells at various markets around the Cusco region. 

She has been successfully doing this work for about four years. Luisa is asking for a loan so that she may update the products that she sells by purchasing newer products. She plans to buy all kinds of new beauty products such as perfumes, lipsticks and shampoos. Luisa is committed to making all of the necessary payments on time.

loans.use: to buy the latest perfumes and hair products to sell at the market

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 36 years old and married with two daughters. They are 8 months and 7 years old. Her occupation is selling clothes in the street and at various markets around the city of Cusco. She sells all types of clothes but specializes in women's undergarments.

 Isabel is asking for a loan in order to buy more women's underpants and brassieres to sell. She is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy more women's undergarments to sell.

loans.name: Shirley Pamela

texts.es:
Shirley es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, tiene 25 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos menores, vive en casa propia, tiene una pareja la cual trabaja en Argentina. Es una joven que luego de muchos problemas retomó sus estudios. Actualmente se encuentra estudiando en la ciudad de San Ignacio en la Universidad del Sur, ella optó por la carrera de Ingeniería Comercial.
Se encuentra en el primer año de la carrera, además se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir en forma ambulante como modo de solventar sus gastos, también es aspirante al Cuerpo de Bomberos de su comunidad. Se define como una joven muy sacrificada, quien está luchando por estudiar, trabajar, pasar con su familia y estar al servicio de su comunidad.
Shirley tiene muchos deseos de terminar su carrera, trabajar en su profesión, contar con un buen ingreso, seguir especializándose, y ayudar a su familia. Ella solicita el préstamo para el pago de los gastos de la facultad como las cuotas, materiales y demás. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le da.
texts.en:
Shirley is from San Ignacio,is 25 years old, mother of three and lives in a house she owns, her partner works in Argentina.  She is a young woman that after many problems went back to school.  She is currently studying in the city of San Ignacio at South University, she is studying Commercial Engineering.

She is in the first year of school and also sells clothing, she also aspires to become a firefighter in her community.  She describes herself as a woman that has had to give up a lot of things and that is fighting hard to study, work, spend time with her family and be of service to her community.

Shirley wishes to finish school and have a career, make a good income, continue with a specialization and help her family by providing her children with a better quality of life.  She requests a loan to pay for school costs such as tuition, supplies and others.  She thanks the institution for the opportunity.

loans.use: Pago de las cuotas de la universidad, como así también materiales y demás.

loans.name: Fidencio

texts.es: El Sr Fidencio se acerco a nuestra institución para solicitar un crédito ya que tiene la necesidad de impermeabilizar el techo de su vivienda debido a que en temporada de lluvias el agua se trasmina a través del techo ocasionando humedad y por lo tanto enfermedades para él y para su familia, esto le preocupa mucho ya que también la humedad se está empezando a pasar por las paredes de toda la casa.
texts.en: Sr. Fidencio approached Credituyo to request a loan because he needs to waterproof the roof of his home.  During the rainy season, water will seep through the roof and the resulting moisture promotes diseases that could make him and his family ill.  He is also concerned about the moisture that is starting to permeate through the walls of his entire house.

loans.use: to waterproof the roof of his house.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, vive con sus tres hijos, se dedica a la venta de semilla de marañón, ropa y cosméticos, inicio con el negocio hace varios años, trabaja de forma ambulante, no tiene un horario fijo y ha ganado clientes con su experiencia.
Actualmente necesita invertir un préstamo en ropa y semilla de marañón, con esta mercadería lograra satisfacer la demanda de los clientes, y aumentar la mercadería creciendo con el negocio.
La aspiración de ella es que su negocio crezca y lograr el establecimiento de un local de venta, apoyar a sus hijos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Teresa lives with her three children. She sells marañón seeds, clothes and cosmetics. She started the business several years ago and works as a street vendor. She has no set schedule and has gained customers with her experience.

At present, she needs to invest a loan in clothes and marañón seeds. With this merchandise, she will be able to satisfy her customers' demands and increase her merchandise, growing her business.  

She aspires to growing her business and opening up a store, supporting her children and improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy marañon seeds to sell.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.es: Yelena tiene 38 años, es una mujer muy alegre, amable y responsable, convive con su pareja, con quien tiene un hijo de seis años. Juntos habitan en su casa propia e intentan dar una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo. El trabajo de Yelena consiste en la venta de bebidas gasificadas, además tiene un mototaxi que alquila, y eso significa un ingreso extra en su hogar. Por otro lado posee una pequeña chacra, en el cual se encarga de trabajarlo en sociedad con su pareja. Lleva haciendo estas actividades recién por dos años y cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que trabaja a lado de su hijo ya que el tiempo le da es para poder cuidarlo. Su casa esta ubicado en un punto estratégico y así tiene clientes todos los días y eso le genera buenas ventas y ganancias, espera poder mantener su negocio ya que se siente cómoda con lo que tiene. Este será el cuarto crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes parsa invertir en su negocio. Con el monto solicitado, comprará repuestos para su mototaxi, además pagará al mecánico que le refaccionará su moto, asimismo comprará bebidas para tener mas variedad en su tienda.
texts.en:
Yelena is 38 years old.  She is a very cheerful, kind and responsible woman who lives with her partner.  The couple have a 6-year-old son.  They live in their own home and are trying to provide their son with a better quality of life.

Yelena's business is selling carbonated drinks.  She also has a motorcycle taxi that she rents out and this makes an additional income for her household.  In addition, she owns a small farm where she works together with her partner.  She has been working in these businesses for two years and has the support of her partner.  What she enjoys about her work is that she works alongside her son and is able to care for him.  Yelena's home is located in a strategic position and so she has customers every day.  This means she has good sales and makes good profits.  She hopes to be able to keep her business going as she feels comfortable with what she has.

This will be Yelena's fourth loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive your support so that she can invest in her business.  She will use the sum she has requested to buy spare parts for her motorcycle taxi.  She will also pay the mechanic who will refurbish her motorcycle and buy drinks so that she has a greater variety in her store.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Twaha

texts.en:
Twaha is 36 years old and lives in the town of Ntungamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has 6 children who are all currently in school. For the past 14 years, Twaha has been working hard to manage his small farm, which grows a variety of vegetables. 

To help expand his business, Twaha has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase fertilizer,  and will help him generate greater profits and improve his family's welfare. He hopes that in the future he will be able to open up a supermarket. 

Twaha is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like him who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora Maria , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , es soltera , no tiene hijos a su cargos , ya todos son casados e independientes , los planes futuros hacia su vivienda es poder  realizar un pequeño anexo para montar su negocio de comidas rápidas ; ya que donde ella vende actualmente es alquilado , doña Maria desde hace varios años se dedica al comercio anteriormente alquilaba sillas y mesas pero no le funciono ; ahora cuenta con el negocio de comida rápidas , la mayor afectación que se le presenta es que no cuanta con  el recurso económico para poder  brindarle variedad de comida , como pollo rostizados , helados ,entre otra cosas. El financiamiento lo quiere para incrementar el inventario del negocio. Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva ya que sin ellos pequeños comerciante como ella no podrían echar andar mas allá su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria is a resident of the town of Ticuantepe. She is single and has no dependents since all of her children are married and live on their own. Her future plans for her home include building a small annex where she can establish her fast food business. She currently rents the place where she sells. Doña has been a merchant for several years. She previously rented out tables and chairs, but that business did not succeed, so now she sells fast food. The greatest impact on her business is not having the financial resources to provide a variety of food, such as roasted chicken, ice cream, and other items.

The loan she is requesting will increase her business inventory. She is grateful for the support that AFODENIC has provided by offering Kiva funds, because without them, small businesspeople like her would not be able to go very far.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, candy, sodas, and other items.

loans.name: Denson

texts.en:
Denzon is a responsible father who raised his family in a village. He is 47 and has five school-age children. Farming is the major source of his income; he plants fruits and vegetables for sale. His ambition in life is to improve his family's status of living and provide education for all his children. Despite the hardships of life, he has the strong determination to achieve his goals.

He aims to increase his production of vegetables to increase his income. Due to financial difficulty, he is asking for a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides needed in vegetable production. He hopes that his loan will help a lot to increase his yields.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides needed in vegetable production.

loans.name: Sheryl Grace

texts.en:
Sheryl Grace is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
 
Sheryl Grace has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Sheryl Grace is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Sheryl Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Aida

texts.ru:
Аида родилась  и выросла в среднеобеспеченной семье.  После смерти отца она  вместе с семьей переехала в село Ак - Суу,  ближе к родственникам. После окончания школы, Аида поступила в Финансовый колледж,  но к сожалению,  не закончила его, так как вышла замуж.  Родив сына в браке, Аида развелась  и поселилась у своей матери.  Сегодня Аида является единственным кормильцем для своего девятилетнего сына и парализованной матери. Для того,  чтобы прокормить свою маленькую семью, Аида занялась торговлей продуктами питания.  Со стартовой суммой в 10,000 сом (KGS), она решила открыть маленький магазин на  территории собственного дома.  Сейчас  в товарообороте  в магазине Аиды около 30,000 сом,  и в ее планах - расширение бизнеса. Именно с этой целью, Аида обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента товаров. 
 Трудолюбивая  и целеустремленная Аида мечтает поставить на ноги маму  и создать все условия для счастливой жизни своему сыну.
texts.en: Aida was born and grew up in a middle-class family.  Following her father's death, she moved to the Ak-Suu village together with her family, so that they could be closer to relatives.  After completing school, Aida was accepted to the Financial College, but, unfortunately, did not finish it because she got married.  She had a son while she was married, then got divorced, and moved in with her mother.  Today, Aida is the sole provider for her nine-year-old son and paralyzed mother.  In order to provide for her small family, Aida got involved in sales of food products.  Using an initial sum of 10,000 som (KGS), she decided to open a small store on the property of her own house.  Currently, she has 30,000 som (KGS) in her turnover, and she plans to expand her business.  Aida requested a loan in the sum of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company specifically to achieve this goal by expanding her merchandise selection.  Hardworking and goal-oriented Aida dreams of helping her mother get back on her feet and providing all of the conditions for a happy life for her son.

loans.use: to expand her merchandise selection

loans.name: Domitila

texts.en:
Domitila is married and blessed with three children who are in school. 

For the last year, she has been selling herbal medicine to support her family.  She also does farming to increase her income. 

In the next 5 years, she plans to open another outlet of her business. 

Domitila dreams of becoming more financially stable. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy herbal medicine for resale.

loans.use: to buy herbal medicine for resale.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 35 years old, married and has four children. To earn a living, he runs a retail shop.  He has been in the business for eleven years.  He also does poultry farming to supplement his family's income.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business because he has been trained on business management.

Moses hopes to grow his business so he can get a good income to provide a quality education to his children.  He needs a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, cooking fat, soap and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat, soap and maize flour

loans.name: Nevaditas De Palcoco Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NEVADITAS DE PALCOCO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Copacabana, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Cleta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: compra y venta de ganado, venta de carne, compra de alimento para ganado, venta de arena, tejido de mantas.

La señora Cleta,  indica que es el primer ciclo que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de un anterior trabajo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de La Paz y posterior a la elaboración lo venderá en la feria. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.
texts.en:
The “NEVADITAS DE PALCOCO” communal bank is starting its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the main Copacabana office. The group has ten members and is governed by a board of directors headed by Señora Cleta. The members' businesses are varied and include: buying and selling livestock; selling meat; livestock feed; sand sales; and knitting blankets.
Cleta says that this is her first cycle with Pro Mujer, and that she joined at the invitation of a promoter. She currently has a business knitting blankets. She has had this business for several years, and learned it from a previous job.
This loan is for increasing her working capital (buying wool). She will buy the wool in La Paz, and will sell her completed blankets in the market. This form of work allows her to generate an income to support her family; she is in a common-law marriage and has two children.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Saiberia Group

texts.en: Joyce is in her late 30's, married and has three children. For the last year, she has earned a living as a food vendor. She works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and makes a good monthly profit. She is applying for her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Joyce used her first loan to buy more items to sell to her customers, and will use the new one to do the same thing. Her dream is to one day have enough money to open a hotel. Joyce will share this loan with her group, Saiberia, which has 16 members, each of whom holds the others accountable for making repayments.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria Isabel es una emprendedora que se le apoyado con el financiamiento para que invierta en su negocio que es la venta de productos varios, en cual es una emprendedora responsable y un record crediticio muy bueno. Ella nos expresa que el crédito anterior invirtió  todo en su negocio para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes variedad de productos. Actualmente está solicitando crédito para comprar productos como chinelas, ropas , zapatos y otros encargos que ya tiene.
texts.en: Maria Isabel is an entrepreneur who has received support through the loans for her business, which is selling general merchandise. She is a responsible entrepreneur with a very good credit record. She tells us that she used the entire previous loan for her business, in order to be able to offer her clients a variety of products. Currently she is asking for a loan to purchase products such as slippers, clothing, shoes, and other orders she already has.

loans.use: to purchase flip-flops, clothing, shoes, and other orders she already has

loans.name: Rosa Mayin

texts.es:
La socia Rosa; pertenece al banco comunal "SEÑOR DE LA AGONIA DE TARAY"; El banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Taray perteneciente a la Provincia de Pisac departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 36 años de edad y es casada, la socia tiene 3 hijos la socia sededica  la artesania la socia  realiza trabajaos en telar y tambien en arcilla como adornos, ceniceros, y los pinta con oxidos naturales, la socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y lleva sus trabajos a vender tres veces a la semana segun lo acordado en su sindicato al mirador de Taray, la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de materiales como arcillas, oxidos naturales, pinceles, lanas y otros para la realización de artesania.


La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the "SEÑOR DE LA AGONIA DE TARAY” Communal Bank. The bank is located in Taray District, part of Pisac Province in Cusco Department.

She is 36 and married with three children. She is an artisan who makes woven and clay goods such as ornaments and ash trays and then paints them with natural oxides. She is a very hardworking woman who takes her products to the tourist lookout in Taray  to sell three times a week, as agreed upon by her union.

Rosa wants to invest the loan in the purchase of materials such as clay, natural oxides, paint brushes, wool and other items used to make her handicrafts.

She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments within the established time period.

loans.use: to buy materials such as clay, natural oxides, paintbrushes, wool and other items used to make handicrafts.

loans.name: Diego Arley

texts.es:
Diego se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y siempre querer ofrecer un mayor bienestar a su familia. Diego es empleado en una empresa la cual le paga un salario que no es suficiente para poder sostener todos los gastos de su hogar, por lo que decidió iniciar un negocio hace aproximadamente 1 mes de venta de productos de uso personal. Diego aprendió gracias a un amigo el cual le enseñó todas las técnicas de la actividad, y gracias a esto ha podido captar muy buenos clientes. Gracias a la buena atención que ofrece, Diego ha podido tener muy buenas ventas, y esto le ha permitido sacar su negocio adelante. Con el ánimo de seguir adelante con su negocio, Diego aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de productos de uso personal para surtir su negocio y continuar ofreciendo buena cantidad de productos a sus clientes. 
Diego espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente, pues podrá ofrecer mayor cantidad y variedad de productos a sus clientes, por lo que aumentarán sus ventas. Diego aspira a que con mayores ingresos su familia pueda gozar de una estabilidad económica y una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Compra de productos de uso personal para surtir su negocio y continuar ofreciendo buena cantidad de productos a sus clientes.

loans.name: Djantoyèrèla Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djantoyèrèla sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 42 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent dans le quartier Pelengana de Ségou et se sont connues à travers des relations de voisinage, de mariage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Pelengana. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de pagnes (wax et bazins), tubercules, condiments (tomate, échalote, choux pommés, . . .) et de jus locaux. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, elles ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Rokiatou (1ère femme debout sur la photo de la gauche vers la droite) est une grande vendeuse de pagnes wax dans le quartier de Pelengana Ségou. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 6 pièces de pagnes wax au grand marché de Ségou.  La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à domicile, au marché de Pelengana et en ambulant dans le quartier à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Rokiatou compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de  20.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et approvisionner le foyer en condiments; Tout comme les autres femmes du groupe, Madame Rokiatou a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: Pour  acheter des pagnes wax.

loans.name: Bihowa Senoudeme C.'s Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois  personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la quatrième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Bihowa Senoudeme C.(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 29 ans. Bihowa Senoudeme C. a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Bihowa Senoudeme C. est mariée à un certain Vitrice. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Bihowa Senoudeme C. vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Bihowa Senoudeme C. Pour cette raison, Bihowa Senoudeme C. vend des tissus, des sacs dames et des chaussures depuis cinq ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Bihowa Senoudeme C. s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Bihowa Senoudeme C. sollicite ensemble avec les membres de son groupe, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus, des sacs dames et des chaussures.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José con 42 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y sus dos hijos, en el distrito de Pucará,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como pollos,gallinas,pavos,etc, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 6 años. Solicita préstamo para fabricación de corrales y para la compra de más animales.

José es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: para fabricación de corrales y para la compra de más animales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the stock of the drugs in the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Gladys would like to buy a high grade dairy cow

loans.name: Fono

texts.en: Fono’s husband is a carpenter, but because it is a family tradition, he fishes after work. Fishing brings in extra money to improve the family's living conditions and meet other financial needs. Fono sells the fish in the road in front of her house every day of the week.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing nets

loans.name: Fedr

texts.en: Fedr K. operates a bicycle parts kiosk in the Gid Market of Mukachevo, Ukraine. He opened his business eight years ago to support his family of five, including three children whom he now supports at the university. Fedr is hard working and kind – he responds easily to people’s needs and enjoys helping clients understand the best methods of repairing bikes. His services are constantly in demand; as such, he would like to learn more about effectively selling his products in order to expand his business. Fedr is currently seeking a loan of $1000 to purchase additional inventory and a wider assortment of parts. With the increased profits, Fedr plans to increase his business base and continue providing quality service and advice to his clients.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es:
Angélica is 46 years old and a single mother of 3 children. They are already grown and only one still lives with her.

She has had a small grocery store in her own home for over 20 years. Angélica says that from a very young age she had to go out and work because she came from a very humble family. She worked as a domestic employee in family homes until she was able to get other work selling food in a small stand which she set up in a strategic location in the city of Itá. Nonetheless she had to close that business due to the fact that she was the victim of various assaults, and from there she decided to install the small grocery store that is now in her home.

Now she has a very established clientele, which is why she has decided to continue with her little business because, as she herself states, the income she obtains with the sales help her to live peacefully and without worries.

She needs a loan to diversify her shop more, buying merchandise like: sugar, rice, noodles, flour, oil, etc.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer) Angélica tiene 46 años, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, todos ya son mayores de edad y solamente uno de ellos vive con ella.

Posee una pequeña despensa que funciona en su casa propia desde hace más de 20 años. Angélica comenta que desde muy pequeña tuvo que salir a trabajar debido a que provenía de una familia muy humilde. Trabajaba como empleada doméstica en casas de familia hasta que pudo conseguir otro trabajo vendiendo comestibles en un pequeño copetín que instaló en una zona estratégica de la ciudad de Itá. Sin embargo tuvo que cerrar dicho negocio debido a que fue victima de varios asaltos y fue allí que se decidió a instalar la pequeña despensa que ahora funciona en su casa.

Ahora ya cuenta con una clientela muy bien formada por lo que está decidida a continuar con su pequeño negocio debido a que, según ella misma manifiesta, los ingresos que obtiene con las ventas le ayudan a vivir tranquila y sin preocupaciones.

Necesita de un préstamo para surtir mejor su despensa comprando mercaderías tales como: azúcar, arroz, fideo, harina, aceite, etc.

loans.use: To buy sugar, oil, flour, rice, etc.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
Mavluda is 50 years old, is married and has 5 children. Mavluda, her husband and daughter work together in the market. Before Mavluda received her first loan 2 years ago she had a small selection of fabrics. Since then Mavluda has been able to expand her inventory and now she sells many different types of fabrics, including more expensive fabrics. Recently Mavluda rented a small shop in the local market. She wants to use her new loan to purchase additional fabrics for her shop.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers

Мавлуде 50 лет, она замужем и у нее 5 детей. На рынок выходят торговать она сама, а также ее муж и старшая дочь. 2 года назад когда она получила свой первый займ ассортимент ее товаров включал в себя всего несколько видов тканей. С тех пор она значительно расширилась и сейчас продает также ткани более дорогие по цене. Недавно она арендовала небольшой магазинчик на местном рынке. Новый займ она хочет получить на приобретение тканей для этого магазинчика.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for her shop

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Together, Feliciana and her husband have owned and operated a thriving business in carpentry and wood sales for more than 15 years. While her husband hand crafts beautiful pieces of furniture, Feliciana takes care of the logistical side of the business taking out loans and managing all financial aspects. Chairs, tables, armoires, and many other exquisite pieces of work are produced within the walls of their workshop which is set up next door to their small home. Once each week, a large bus is rented to take them just outside the city limits of Ayacucho, Peru, where they purchase huge supplies of wood to bring home and craft. As well, they also take a portion of the wood supply to a Sunday market, where it is sold to other carpenters in the area. They also bring their hand-crafted furniture and sell it at the market.

Feliciana has accomplished a great deal in the past 15 years, much of which she attributes to the great help provided her through her village bank. After her first three years of taking out loans and saving money, she and her husband were able to buy a car. Three years after that, they bought a large truck for wood shipments. Today, they continue to save with the goal of funding the university education of her 2 sons. As well, Feliciana would very much like to open a small grocery store from their home, and they are currently in the process of adding a second floor to their house. These are ambitious goals that Feliciana has set for herself, however, she has proven several times over that when she sets a goal, she accomplishes it.

Through her hard work, Feliciana has been able to provide amazing opportunities to her family, and because of this they all appreciate her participation in her village bank. Feliciana’s involvement has become a family affair. She describes how all of her children place great value on the bank because of the great economic help is has provided for all of them over the past 15 years. Feliciana is requesting a loan of $500. With this money, she and her husband will begin to stock up large supplies of wood in preparation for December and January, their busiest months of the year.

loans.use: Stock up on large supplies of wood

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea M. is 40 years old and lives with her three children in Bathambong province, Cambodia. Her husband passed away many years ago so she covers all her family’s expenses by running a stand at an open air market selling fish and earns around $5/day. Mrs. Chea M. is humbly requesting a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her business’s transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use for her business’s transportation

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a trained nurse/midwife who manages her own private facility in Nakuru, Kenya. She is 49 years old and a mother of 5 children, two of whom are still in school. After finishing training as a nurse/midwife in 1985, Rose initially worked with the Ministry of Health. After 9 years, she resigned from the government job and joined Mariostopes International, where she worked until 2001, when she opened her own private clinic in one of the slums of Nakuru where most of her clients come from. Rose offers a wide range of health services, including general curative , family planning, and maternal and child health. In addition, she also runs a pharmacy, a laboratory, and a theatre. Rose attributes her success to hard work, perseverance, and financial assistance from KMET. She currently needs a loan of US$1,200 to be able to expand the clinic and to purchase an additional stock of drugs.

loans.use: Expansion of a clinic and purchase of a stock of drugs

loans.name: Ngin

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngin S. is 41 years old. She sells food from her house in the Plou Paem village near Phnom Penh City in Cambodia. She earns about $3.00 a day from her business. Her husband, Mr. Koy Dok, is a bricklayer and earns about $2.00 a day. They have four children. One of them is a garment worker who earns about $2.00 a day.

To increase their income and better support their large family, they plan to decorate their house to be a proper and attractive place to sell food. They will use this loan of $1,100.00 to decorate their house, and a also partly to pay for their children to go to school.

loans.use: To decorate their house to be proper and attractive as a selling place

loans.name: Telvina

texts.es:
Telvina C. Garcia D. A. she is 59 years old. She studied to only the third graD.. She has two children, but neither one of them depend on her. She lives in sector El Cortijo, in the province of Trujillo, and in the department La Liberated-Peru.

She has a place in the market El Cortijo, where she sells vegetables, condiments and other food items. She trys to buy the best products and supplies at the best prices in order to please her customers and make a profit. She buys her products from a marketplace called “La Hermelinda”. She goes there every morning before she opens her business. She has had her business for a very long time, but before she got the stand, her business was ambulatory.

She belongs to communal bank “Nuevo Peru”. She received her first loan from the communal bank for 300 Soles. With this money she bought a little bit of everything in order to have more variety in her stand.

With the loan of 800 Soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy 2 large sacks of rice, 1 large sack of sugar, one box of oil, legumes, tuna and variety of vegetables

Her dream is to have a bigger business.

Translated from Spanish by Gabe of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Telvina C. García D. A. tiene 59 años D. edad, estudio hasta el tercer grado D. primaria. Tiene dos hijos pero ninguno depenD. D. ella. Vive en el sector El Cortijo en la provincia D. Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

Tiene un puesto ubicado en el mercado zonal El Cortijo, en el que venD. verduras, abarrotes y condimentos; para tener una mayor utilidad compra al por mayor en el mercado “La Hermelinda” todos los días muy temprano antes D. abrir su negocio. Hace muchos años que tiene este negocio a diferencia que antes vendía en condición D. ambulante.

Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Perú” lugar donD. obtuvo su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 dinero con el que compro D. todo un poco para tener variedad en su puesto.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 800.00 que los pagara en cuatro meses comprara dos sacos D. arroz, un saco D. azúcar, una caja D. aceite, menestras, atún y verduras en general.

Su mayor sueño es tener un negocio más granD..

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Honoria

texts.es:
Honoria has been a woman of humble heart since she was girl, always persevering, enterprising, and possessing progressive willpower. Currently, at her small restaurant, she is making an effort to reach her goal, together with her loving children. She has already decided to make space and renovate the place completely. During renovation, she started to sell nutritional products from Omnilife and is currently, achieving good results. Since the investment needed for her project is rather large, she needs to increase her working capital in order to reach her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Honoria es una dama humilde de corazón, desde niña siempre fue perseverante, emprendedora y con gran voluntad de progreso, ahora con su pequeño restaurante está presta a seguir esforzándose para alcanzar su objetivo junto a sus queridos hijos. Y ha decidido implementar su espacio y renovarlo por completo; mientras esto sucede ha incursionado en la venta de productos nutricionales de la marca Omnilife y esta obteniendo muy buenos resultados; debido a que la inversión de dinero en su proyecto es bastante grande le urge incrementar su capital de trabajo para continuar con su anhelo.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina is 34 years old and has four children: Ana María, 12; Julieta, 10; Sergio, 8; and young Sebastian who is 5 years old. Cristina has a business set up at home where she manufactures shoes, sandals, and boots. Once she has manufactured the footwear, it is delivered to the stores and they finish the details. There is little competition in this field as the work requires qualified and specialized labor. With the present loan Cristina will buy three machines that will allow her to become more independent and to increase her income. She will buy two straight stitch sewing machines and a serger (overlock machine). This is Cristina’s third credit with this institution and she has proven to be a responsible person, punctual with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Cristina tiene 34 años de edad y tiene una familia que consta de sus cuatro hijos Ana María de 12 años, Julieta de 10 años, Sergio de 8 años y el pequeño Sebastian de 5 años de edad. Cristina tiene instalado en su domicilio su negocio que es donde se preparan calzados, sandalias y botas. Una vez se producen los mismos entonces se entrega a las zapaterías para que las mismas finalicen el trabajo. Existe una competencia media en este rubro, esto debido a que el tipo de trabajo requiere de mano de obra calificada y especializada. Con el presente crédito comprará tres máquinas las cuales le permitirán ser más independiente y a la vez a percibir mayores ingresos. Comprará dos máquinas de costura recta y una máquina sesgadora. Este es el tercer crédito de Cristina con la institución y demostró ser una persona responsable y puntual con sus pagos.

loans.use: Purchase sewing machines to increase manufacture of footwear.

loans.name: Kao

texts.en: Kao N., 45, and her husband have six children, four of whom are students, while another is a taxi driver and another no longer lives at home. They have grown rice since 1979, and on average make $1.50 each day.   Currently, the price of rice keeps rising due to a shortage caused by last year’s drought in provinces such as Siem Reap and the fact that most of the farmers sold their harvest to neighboring countries such as Vietnam.  Kao N. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to acquire more land to grow rice as well as purchase a motorbike for her son for transportation to his job.  (Mrs. Kao is pictured with her little daughter.)

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and farmland.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Half of the members of the group Benkadi are married and half are single. The average age of the group is 27. The group has on average three children and lives in monogamous families in the district of Torakabougou in Bougouni (the region of Sikasso in the Republic of Mali).

They sell various items (wood carbon, grains, locally manufactured soap, tea, milk and sugar) as their main businesses.

The members of the group Benkadi mainly know each other because of friendship and blood relations. Three years ago, in their search for financial capital to expand the amount of their investments, they decided together to work with Soro Yiriwaso. The group is on its fifth loan and the previous loans have been paid back without difficulties.

With this loan, they hope (as a whole) to purchase: 20 sacks of carbon, 200 kilograms of grains, 2 cartons of soap, 1 sack of powdered sugar, nearby the wholesalers in the market of Bougouni. They make their sales at the market in Torakabougou under the sheds, on top of the slacks and from home, where the neighbors in the district obtain fresh supplies day and night.

The members of Benkadi would like to become wholesalers at the level of Torakabougou, where the population is growing.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva volunteer.

Les membres du groupe Benkadi sont à moitié marié et moitié célibataire ayant une moyenne d’age 27 ans et 3 enfants qui vivent dans des familles monogames au quartier de Torakabougou de Bougouni( Régoin de Sikasso République du Mali. ) Elles ont comme activités principales le commerce d’articles divers(charbon de bois,céréales,savon de fabrication locale,thé lait sucre). Les membres du gruope Benkadi sont liés par des liens d’amitié et surtout de parenté. Dans leurs recherches de ressources financières en vue d’aggrandir la taille de leurs investissements elles ont décidé ensemble de nouer un parténariat avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans.Le groupe est à son cinquième pret et les précédents ont été remboursés sans difficultés. Elles comptent (constituée des stocks) en achetant avec ce pret: 20 sacs de charbon, 200 kg céréales,2 cartons de savon, 1 sac de sucre en poudre auprès des grossistes du grand marché de Bougouni. Elles effectuent leurs ventes au marché de Torakabougou sous des hangars sur des étales et à domicile ou les voisins du quartier s’y ravitaillent nuit et jour. Les membres de Benkadi veulent dvenir des grossistes au niveau de Torakabougou ou la population est en nette croissance.

loans.use: Purchase wood carbon and other various consumption products

loans.name: Fanis Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Fanis Gonzales se dedica al negocuio de elaboracion y venta de comida ofreciendola en su casa de habitacion y preparando variedad de platillos para su respectiva venta. Este negocio lo ha venido desarrollando desde hace 20 años y ha logrado con esto suplir las necesidades de sus dos hijos en edad escolar. A medida que han venido transcurriendo los años el negocio ha venido desarrollandose y esto gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel el cual le ha proporcionado creditos los cuales los ha invertido directamente en la compra de la materia prima para su negocio. Hoy en dia una vez mas solicita un credito confiando que su peticion le será arpobada y de esta forma saldrá adelante en su negocio.
