Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Ms. Fanis Gonzales works selling and cooking food in a room in her home where she prepares a variety of dishes for sale. She has been working in this business for 20 years and in doing so has been able to achieve the needs of her two school aged children. Over the years her business has grown thanks to the financial support provided by Ceprodel. She has used her previous loans to invest in the purchase of raw material for her business. Once again she has requested a loan confident that her request will be approved and thus will able to improve her business.

loans.use: Purchase of raw material

loans.name: Blanca Amelia

texts.es:
La señora Blanca Amelia V. Ibáñez, tiene cincuentaicinco años y vive en la calle San Martín 204 del distrito de Mache provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió la primaria completa, sus padres no pudieron seguir educándola por medios económicos.
Se casó de diecisiete años con el señor Robert Santos Guzmán y tiene dos hijos vivos y dos hijos muertos. 
Su negocio que funciona en su casa es de compra venta de cerdos, los compra vivos y los vende en carne.
Recuerda que empezó a trabajar con Manuela Ramos desde hace once años aproximadamente, en ese entonces tenía una bodega, así que su primer préstamo de 300 soles los invirtió en comprar arroz, fideo, gaseosas y cerveza para surtir su bodega, devolvió el préstamo en cuatro meses.
Actualmente solicitará un préstamo de 1000 soles con los que comprará siete cerditos pequeños, los que engordará y serán vendidos en carne, ese préstamo también será devuelto en cuatro meses.
Blanca es una mujer con mucha visión de negocio, es muy activa con mucha vitalidad para organizarse y trabajar desde tempranas horas.
Participa como socia en el comedor popular Corazón de María y es presidenta en el Banco Comunal Progresistas.
Sueña con viajar mucho y conocer el Perú en especial el Cuzco.
texts.en:
Mrs. Blanca Amelia V. Ibáñez is 55 years old and lives on San Martin Street in the Mache district of Otuzco, in the La Libertad department of Peru. She completed an elementary school education, but for economic reasons her parents were unable to continue educating her. When she was 17, she married Mr. Robert Santos Guzman and they had four children, two of whom died.

She runs her business buying and selling pigs from her house. She buys the animals alive, then sells their meat. She says that she began working with Manuela Ramos 11 years ago, when she had a general store, and she spent her first loan on rice, pasta, sodas and beer to supply her store. She paid off the loan in 4 months.

She is currently requesting a loan of 1000 soles (about US $330) to buy seven piglets, which she will fatten up, slaughter and sell their meat. She will pay off this loan in 4 months.

Blanca is a woman with a vision for her business. She is very active and has the liveliness to get organized and start working at the crack of dawn. She is a member of the Corazon de Maria eatery and is president of the Progresistas Communal Bank. She dreams of traveling, and would like to get to know other parts of Peru, especially Cuzco.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy piglets

loans.name: Fatma's Group

texts.en:
Fatma has been selling food in Zanzibar for three years. She works daily from 7:00am to 6:00pm and earns a monthly profit of approximately $65. She is hoping that by taking out her first loan, she will be able to expand her business and increase her earnings.

Fatma will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Harifa, Mtumwa, Mtama and Habiba.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell in her business.

loans.name: Srea's Group

texts.en:
This group loan, which consists of six people, is located in Preak Reussei Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Srea S. was selected by the members as the group leader.

She is a farmer who owns 0.8-hectare of land and cultivates rice to earn a living. Since her plantation field is far from irrigation, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a pump to water her field and make her crops more productive.

Her husband, Mr. Cheng Chheang, is a fisherman who earns a small income to support his family. Mrs. Srea S. is 24 years old and the mother of two children who are ages 1 and 4, too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy a pump to generate water for her field to make her crops more productive.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth O. is 24 years old and is married to a local businessman. They have two children, one of whom is in school. They live in Rongo, Kenya.

Elizabeth owns a shoe store in Rongo, where she sells new shoes. Elizabeth has owned the shop since 2005 and buys the shoes from the nearby town of Kisii.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenya Schillings in order to expand her business by purchasing a larger variety with other types of shoes.

loans.use: To purchase shoes

loans.name: Tautai Tutaia

texts.en: Tautai Tutaia M., 58, is married with 8 children.  She has 1 year of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public 4 days per week. She has had 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (about $125 USD).  SPBD loans are Tautai Tutaia’s only access to capital because she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy chemicals, seedlings and farming equipment to further improve her business.

loans.use: To buy chemicals, knives and seedlings for her farming business

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Mr. Yan Y., 61, and his wife, Mrs. Mot Prum, 53, who live in a small village in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia, married in 1979 and have three children: two sons who are married and live outside the family home, and one daughter.

Yan and his wife have been growing rice since they married. Yan hopes to continue his business. He is requesting a loan of US$ 400 to use for growing rice.

loans.use: To use for growing rice

loans.name: Shabana Shahzadi M. Khalid Group

texts.en:
Shabana Shahzadi Baji is 29 years old, married, and has been a citizen of a historical place called Yadgar of the famous city of Lahore in Pakistan for the past three years. Shabana Baji is an educated lady. She completed her education through the tenth standard. Her parents always felt proud of her because she was a brilliant student in the class. She married a man named M. K. who has a Punjabi food (biryani) selling business. “Biryani” is a dish  made from rice and chicken meat. Pakistani people are fond of this dish. He has been doing this business for the past ten years. Shabana Baji is a very devoted and caring wife. She helps her husband in preparing this dish. She is applying for a loan to buy material (rice and meat) to expand the biryani selling business. 

Shabana Baji is a group leader of other women in her locality. Razia Baji wants a loan to buy another motorbike for their rented motorbikes business. Irshad Baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics for her parlor. Rashida Baji wants a loan to buy artificial jewelry to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own businesses. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more material for their food selling business

loans.name: Ruth Manuela

texts.es:
La señora Ruth es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de Guadalupe”, en la comunidad de Sajjo, en el distrito de Pomata, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 03 hijos y posee estudios de secundaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 12 años, ella se dedica al engorde de ganado mayor (toros) y la venta de golosinas, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra de mercadería para su negocio (golosinas y bebidas). 
Ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 05 cuotas mensuales, con dicho préstamo ella desea adquirir ganado menor (ovejas y porcinos) para someterlos a engorde y posteriormente venderlos como carne; asimismo desea adquirir mas mercadería (golosinas) además de bebidas y otros; de esta manera ella piensa invertir todas sus ganancias en la implementación de una sastrería puesto que su esposo es “sastre” y se dedica a esta actividad, con ello desea brindar una adecuada educación a sus hijos a nivel superior.
texts.en:
Ruth is a member of the “Virgen de Guadalupe” cooperative bank, located in the Sajjo community, Pomata district, in Puno. She is 37 years old, married, has 3 children, and completed her education through secondary school. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for 12 years. She dedicates herself to raising livestock (bulls) and to selling sweets/snacks. With her first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles, she invested in the purchase of merchandise for her business (snacks and beverages). She requires a loan of 1,200.00 additional soles, which she commits to repaying in 5 monthly installments, to buy additional animals (sheep and pigs) to raise, fatten, and subsequently sell as meat. Concurrently, she would like to buy additional merchandise (snacks), beverages, and other items. She is thinking about investing all her earnings into implementing a tailor’s shop, since her husband is a tailor and dedicates himself to this activity. With this, she would like to provide an adequate education for her children up to advanced levels.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase small livestock to raise and fatten.  To buy sweets/snacks, beverages and other items.

loans.name: Confianza Y Desarrollo 1 And 2 Group

texts.en:
The members of this Bank of Hope are starting their fifth loan cycle with Esperanza International. The name of their Bank is "Confianza y Desarrollo" which means, in English, Trust and Development. Definitely one cannot go without the other. The two group coordinators are Hector O. and Jackelin M.. 

Hector makes candy. He makes several kinds of staple Dominican sweets, which have milk, coconut, and peanuts usually. They are sweetened with sugar and enhanced with spices like cinnamon and cloves for a more distinctive flavor. Hector's hopes are to make his business into a candy factory where he can hire staff to make the candy and move forward to a more administrative position. He hopes to become a lead candy distributor in the San Pedro province. 

Jackelin, on the other hand, has a colmado: a small convenience store where she sells the daily meal items. She will use this loan to buy canned goods like beans and sardines. The Dominican Republic suffers serious power outages and a lot of people do not own a refrigerator, so canned goods are a more convenient option, being less perishable. Her hopes are that the profits of her colmado will allow her one day to build a house with firmer materials.
 
These entrepreneurs have shown outstanding credit behavior and great will to work. Thank you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase sugar, coconut, milk and spices to make candy

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 35 years old and is married with 5 children. She sells fruit like banana, oranges, mangoes, etc. She has requested a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more fruit to sell. She hopes to become a major fruit distributor in future. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit for resale

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Mrs. Ofelia B. is married to a motorcycle driver. Sad to say, this couple has not been given a child yet. Ofelia got bored staying at home, busy doing nothing. And so, she asked her husband for permission to join Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, to take advantage of its programs and benefits. Ofelia became a member of Paglaum MPC just this March, 2009. She has applied for 5,000 PHP as capital for her sari-sari (general) store, particularly to buy soft drinks and other beverages.

This couple wishes to have their own child one day. Ofelia is very grateful that she is a member of PMPC and has the opportunity to use Kiva services as well.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and other beverages to sell

loans.name: Mason

texts.en:
Mason E. is 28 years old and single. He is a mechanic who also sells spare auto parts.

He hopes for a loan in the amount of N80,000 to purchase more parts to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more spare auto parts to sell.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita Q. is from the village of Batinay, Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 50 years old. Angelita is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Angelita owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling pre-packed snack foods, dairy products and daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Angelita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Angelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Angelita is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Angelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

location.town: Batinay, Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Or

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila D. is from the village of Katipunan. She is 40 years old. Leonila is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Leonila owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Leonila has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Leonila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonila successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Leonila is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Leonila from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Mrs. Margaret B. is a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She has two children: one is working and the other one is already married.

Margaret obtained her third loan of Php 5,000 in the special program of Paglaum called Paglaum Development Program for Landless People. Her proposed project is hog-raising.

Margaret is happy to have this project because it provides more help to her family, especially for their basic needs. She gives her warmest thanks to Paglaum because she enjoys the services and other benefits of Paglaum like insurance and savings deposit.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for hog-raising

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca P. is from the village of Pigasag-an, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 39 years old. Rebecca is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Rebecca owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Rebecca is just starting this business.

In 2008, Rebecca joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Rebecca from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Dumaloan

texts.en: Dumaloan S. is from the village of Tinagaan, Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Dumaloan owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily buying and selling bananas in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Dumaloan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Dumaloan is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita T. is from the village of Lower Tiparak, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 47 years old, is married, and has nine school-aged children. Teresita owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-eight years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Teresita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
L. socia Cristina, pertenece al banco comunal, TAMBOPATA D. TIPON; ubicado en el distrito D. Oropeza, perteneciente a L. provincia D. Quispicanchis, en el departamento D. Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 25 años D. edad, elL. es conviviente y alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, nuestra socia compra y venD. todo tipo D. prendas D. vestir y también venD. cosméticos, elL. solicita el préstamo como capital D. trabajo, nuestra socia reinvertirá en su pequeño negocio el dinero.

Nuestra socia se muestra muy feliz por el apoyo otorgado, elL. se compromete a cumplir con el pago en el plazo establecido, deseando así que su crédito aumente.
texts.en:
Cristina belongs to Tambopata D. Tipon community bank, located in the Oropeza district of Quispicanchis province, department of Cusco. This member is 25 years old and lives with her partner. She balances her responsibilities at home with retail traD.. She buys and sells all kinds of clothing and also sells cosmetics. She is requesting a loan for working capital to invest in her small business activities. Cristina is very happy with the support she receives from the institution. She is committed to making all her payments in the established time, and hopes to build good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Obasuyi

texts.en: V.is 53years old and is married with 7 children. She sells cooked foods. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is requesting for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuff. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuff to cook and drinks to sell

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona N. is from the village of Cabacungan, Claveria Mis. Or. She is 36 years old. Alona is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Alona runs a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Alona has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Alona joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional business capital. Alona is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Alona from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to buy household appliances. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
El Sra. Marina, tiene vivienda propia en la localidad de San Jose, distante 20 Kms de El Torno, departamento de Santa Cruz. Su actividad economica principal es la venta de asaditos (bifes)de carne de cerdo, esta actividad la realiza en la zona central del pueblo. Ella vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos; el esposo tiene su actividad propia que es el transporte publico, cuenta con su propio vehiculo.
 El crédito solicitado lo invertiran en la compra de productos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Marina has her own home in San Jose, 20 kms from El Torno, Santa Cruz department. She sells grilled pork steaks in the center of town. She lives with her husband and their two children. Her husband has his own job in public transport and has his own vehicle. The funds will be used to buy products at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr: Maïmouna D. est âgée de 40 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle fait de la transformation et vente de pâte d'arachide. Elle a une bonne expérience de cette activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle soutien son mari dans les charges collectives de la famille.
texts.en:
Maïmouna D., aged 40, is married and the mother of five children. She produces and sells peanut butter. She is very experienced in this business, as she has practiced it for over five years. She helps her husband with the common expenses of the family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To boost her activity

loans.name: Family Affairs Group

texts.en:
These are members of the 'Family Affairs' group. They are small-scale businesspeople in the northern city of Makeni. This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva.  With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, making more sales and better profit. Consequently, their living standards will improve, they can at least provide three meals a day for their children; pay their schools fees, buy them clothes to wear, and pay their medical bills in case any of them fall sick. 

Ibrahim J. (right) is the leader of this group. Ibrahim was born in Makeni. He is twenty-eight years of age, married to a businesswoman, and they have one child who is two years old. Ibrahim is a carpenter. He makes beds, chairs, benches, and tables. He has been a carpenter for eight years now. He will use this loan to buy working materials like boards, nails, and a saw.

loans.use: Buy working material like boards, nails, and a saw

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.en:
R. Munavvar is 43-year old loving mother of three children. For more than 17 years, Munavvar has sold fish in the central fish market of the city. When she started she had only $100 United States dollars (USD) in turnover. With time, her business expanded and today it is a quite stable business. Munavvar has requested a loan in the amount of $1,500 USD. She wants to purchase a quantity of fish at wholesale prices in order to have stock to sell during the New Year's celebration when fishing is prohibited. Munavvar has shown herself to be a reliable client and has been already provided with the loan by IMON. She would like to thank everyone for their support.
More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.
IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy a quantity of fish at wholesale prices for resale during New Year's celebration.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Esta clienta tiene a su cargo dos hijos, estos se  encuentran en edad escolar, esta casada, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante diez años, en ese lapso ha invertido  12 créditos en la mejora de las condiciones de su vivienda otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es un excelente Cliente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales para la remodelación del Techo de su  vivienda y el pago de la mano obra, para darles una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 

Ella dijo que los financiamientos otorgados por ceprodel le han ayudado mucho por lo que ahora cuenta con una vivienda segura.
texts.en:
This woman has two dependent children who are in school. She has worked with CEPRODEL for ten years and received twelve home improvement loans. She is an excellent client. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase materials needed to refurbish the roof of her house and pay for labor. This will provide better living conditions for her children. She says the loans from CEPRODEL have helped greatly in making her home more secure.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for materials & labor to make roof repairs.

loans.name: Swannie

texts.en:
Swannie A. is a 27-year-old mother who cares for her four children. She is married to Ferdinand, who is a carpenter. To help her husband support the family, she started a business of making and selling doormats. 

With dreams of getting away from poverty, she came up with the idea in 2008 of joining the Kiva field partner in the Philippines, ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap Inc.), which means “To Rise Up from Poverty”. Since her membership in the institution she had shown good performance in her credit rating (basis of loans), allowing her to get more capital for her business.

Now on her third loan, she applied for 15,000 PHP to buy an assortment of raw materials for her business, such as cotton, flannel, and other supplies.

In the future, Swannie hopes to establish a shop where she can fulfill orders. She also wants to be able to save for her children's education and to have a comfortable house for living in with a happy family.

NOTE: Please disregard the date appearing on the picture. The camera internal date was not set on the right date.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana O. cooks and sells waakye (rice with beans) at Abura near Cape Coast. She has received senior high education. She is married and has three children and her husband is a mechanic.

Juliana has been selling waakye for some time now and supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy foodstuffs to cook for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to reinvest in her business and to further her children’s education.

To prepare waakye, Juliana gets her beans, rice and colored leaves from the market. She cooks the beans till they become a little tender, adds the colored leaves to give the beans and the boiling water a wine color then she adds her rice to get a mixture of the rice and beans in the water. She cooks it until it becomes tender to eat.

Waakye is normally eaten with macaroni, wele (smoked cow hide), gari (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava), salad with pepper sauce, tomatoes sauce, and fish of any kind and meat of your choice.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fish to sell wholesale and retail

loans.name: Nory Isabel

texts.es:
Nory A. de 41 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, en su vivienda cuenta con agua y luz como servicio básico, su esposo es chofer ellos tienen 3 hijos de 26, 20, 18 años. 

Debido a la necesidad económica ella tuvo que abandonar su trabajo como comerciante informal. Hace 15 años atrás Nory y su esposo vendieron un auto que tenían y el dinero lo utilizaron para tener una papelería. 

En estos tiempos ella cuenta con un local propio en el Fortín. Trabaja desde las 06h00 de la mañana, su hija mayor le ayuda. Ha implementado vender ropa y perfumes en la papelería. La delincuencia es uno de de los factores de alto riesgo en su negocio. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, ropa, zapatos para incrementar su negocio. En el futuro quiere que su negocio se expanda a las provincias del Ecuador.
texts.en:
Nory A. is 41 years old and lives in the suburbs of Fortín de Guayaquil. She has the basic services of water and light in her home. Her husband is a driver and they have three children ages: 26, 20, 18. For economic reasons she had to leave her job as an informal merchant. Fifteen years ago Nory and her husband sold a car they had and used the money they got to open a paper store. Right now she has her own store in Fortín. She starts working at six in the morning and her daughter helps her. She also sells clothing and perfumes in the paper store. One of the high risk factors in her business is delinquency. She wants to buy notebooks, clothing, and shoes with her loan money to increase her business. She would like to expand her business to all of Ecuador in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks, clothing, shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy construction material

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em R., 55, is widowed and resides with four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorian temples. She sells grilled frogs and palm fruit for an income of about USD 3 per day. The family is also assisted by three of her children.  R. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a motorbike, with a trailer attached, to transport palm fruit to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to build a new house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike with a trailer attached.

loans.name: Elba's Group

texts.en:
Elba A. is from Buenavista Santiago City. She is 45 years old. Elba is the group leader of a 17-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Elba A.'s group.

Elba is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Elba owns & operates a tailoring business, primarily providing general alterations & tailoring services to local community members. Elba has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elba joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Elba has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. Elba is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. This will be the third loan taken out by Elba from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics & materials.

loans.name: Rossi Melva

texts.es:
Rossi tiene 48 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo en el distrito D. Chocope D. la provincia D. Ascope, en la región La Libertad. La zona se encuentra ubicada a mas D. dos horas y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Rossi es cocinera, se vale D. esta actividad para percibir ingresos y ayudar a su esposo en el sostenimiento D. su familia. Ella trabaja en una pollería (restaurante en donD. se venD. pollo a la brasa – Pollo aderezado y cocinado en brasas D. carbón) en la ciudad en donD. vive desD. hace mas D. dos años, ella está encargada D. preparar los pollos y despacharlos. 

Adicionalmente todos los dias venD. muy temprano visceras D. cerdo en el mercado D. la ciudad, ella las compra ya limpiadas a los carniceros D. la zona y las revenD. a los comerciantes D. comida, las visceras D. cerdo son muy consumidas, ya que se utilizan para preparar chicharrones y pancitas (ambos son platos preparados en base a frituras, los primeros se fríen en una olla común y los ultimos se fríen en brasas D. carbón).

Rossi desea ampliar su negocio D. venta D. visceras para empezar a distribuir su mercadería en restaurantes mas grandes, por este motivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1400 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra D. mas visceras.

Rossi es una mujer optimista y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es llegar a formar su propio restaurante. En la zona donD. vive y en su trabajo ella es muy querida y estimada.
texts.en:
Rossi is 48 years old, married, and lives with her husband in the district of Chocope, Ascope province, in the La Libertad region. The area she lives in is located more than 2 and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region. Rossi is a cook; she relies on this work to earn income and help her husband support their family. She works in a pollería (restaurant offering charcoal-roasted, seasoned chicken) in the city where she has lived for more than 2 years. Rossi is in charge of preparing and serving the barbecued chicken. In addition, early every morning Rossi sells pork offals at the city market. She buys entrails from local butchers and cleans them, then resells to food vendors. Pork offals are in high demand because they are used to prepare chicharron (fried pork rinds) and pancitas (tripe). Both are fried dishes; the latter is fried over red-hot coals and the former is prepared in a normal pot. Rossi wishes to expand her business selling offals to distribute to larger restaurants. For this reason she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,400 PEN, which she plans to invest in buying pork entrails. Rossi is an optimistic and hardworking woman. Her greatest dream is to start her own restaurant. Rossi is very beloved and respected in the communities where she works and lives.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pork offals to expand business sales.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia T. is from the town of Fugu Jones. She is 57 years old and married with five adult children. To make a living, Aurelia buys and sells fruit. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2300 PHP a month.

In 2009, Aurelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale. Aurelia is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will also be used to purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale. This will be the third loan taken out by Aurelia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Sulton

texts.en:
Sulton A. is a married man with three adult children. Faced with high unemployment in his country, it proved very hard to find a job and he thus began his own business selling clothes and head-dress. Fortunately, his sales have been good and his business is growing thanks to the quality of his products and the good service he provides. Sulton now needs a loan of 5000 Somoni, which he will use to buy goods to respond to customer demand. He is very thankful to you for helping him to improve his service and his family's quality of life.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new clothing for sales

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, de 22 años, vive en la casa de sus padres, en compañía de su pareja Erica (24), con quien tiene una pequeña hija Génesis (1).Con la enseñanza agrícola de sus padres, en la actualidad esta dedicado  al cultivo de alverja en sus terrenos ubicados en la sierra peruana, pero también siembra grandes extensiones de papa en terrenos arrendados ubicados en la  costa, y para el cultivo cuenta con la ayuda de sus hermanos. Lo que más le gusta es cosechar sus frutos, porque al comercializarlos observa en las ganancias la recompensa de todo su sacrificio. Ya lleva 5 años en la agricultura, y ha logrado adquirir una chacra de gran extensión, además puede cubrir los gastos del hogar, y sobre todo ahorrar, pues para más adelante, tiene muchos planes entre ellos están el de sembrar en mayor cantidad, instalar un negocio de venta de combustible y un taller de mantenimiento de vehículos, pues  tiene conocimientos de mecánica automotriz.Es  la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y le gusta mucho trabajar con su grupo comunal, junto a los demás integrantes de su grupo.Carlos tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono que distribuirá sobre sus cultivos de alverja ya desarrollados, también adquirirá   semillas de alverja y papa, así espera obtener mejores ganancias con la nueva producción.
texts.en:
Carlos is 22 years old. He lives in his parents’ house with his life parter, 24 year old Erica, and their small one year old daughter, Génesis. Using what his parents taught him about farming, he now devotes himself to growing peas. His fields are located on the Peruvian mountain range. He also plants potatoes on large tracts of rented land on the coast. His siblings help him with the crops. What he likes best is harvesting the produce. He likes it because when he sells the produce he sees his earnings as the recompense for all of his sacrifice. He has been farming for five yeas. He has managed to get a farm with a wide expanse of land. He has also been able to cover the household expenses. Above all, he has been saving for the future. He has a lot of plans. Among those plans is planting in greater quantity. He also plans to set up a business selling fuel and a vehicle maintenance shop. He knows about automobile mechanics. This is his second loan with MFP. He really likes working together with the rest of the group’s members in his communal bank. Carlos plans to use the requested money to buy various sacks of fertilizer to spread on his developed pea crops. He will also get pea and potato seeds. That way he hopes to get better income with the new production.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and seeds to improve the productivity of his crops

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina D. lives in the town of Surallah. She is 38 years old, married and has seven school-aged children. She makes a living as a farmer, growing mainly rice, and has been in this line of work for more than 19 years. 

Divina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid five previous loans from CEVI, and is applying for a new one, for 15,000 PHP, to buy seeds, fertilizer and other items for her farm. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve her family's living standards. 

About CEVI:
Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI provides not only credit for its clients but also savings, insurance and training at regular group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other items for her farm

loans.name: Yoly

texts.es: Yoly tiene 28 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 7 años se dedica a la compra y venta de reses, además diariamente vende la leche que extrae de sus vacas. Manifiesta que a pesar que su trabajo es muy sacrificado le es muy rentable a la vez, además cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo. Se siente muy feliz con el trabajo que realiza, por que le permite tener a toda su familia unida. En tanto los ingresos que recibe son rentables ya que sus vacas producen regular cantidad en litros de leche y sus animales  son de  una raza mejorada que permite venderlo a un buen precio en el mercado. Su deseo es tener un establo amplio donde pueda tener ganado vacuno. Es su tercer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de 2 pequeños toros para su establo.
texts.en:
Yoly is 28 years old and lives in her home with her husband and two children. For more than seven years, she has been buying and selling cattle. In addition, she sells milk extracted from her cows. Yoly says that her work is very profitable even though it requires a lot of sacrifice. She has the support of her husband. Yoly feels happy with the work she has accomplished since it has allowed her entire family to stay together. The income she generates is quite profitable because her cows produce a steady quantity of milk and the animals she sells at the market command a good price since they are of an improved breed. Her wish is to have a larger stable so that she can acquire more cattle.

This is her third loan MFP. Yoly is pleased to know that she has financial support and always demonstrated that she is responsible with her payments. She is glad to be part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive individuals. Yoly is grateful to the people who will be approving her loan request since it will help her advance her business. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase of two small bulls to keep in her stable.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two small bulls

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es: El Señor Jesús dedicado a la venta de plomo, el plomo lo extraen de las baterías usadas  y esto lo funden para venderlo en un precio considerable pero este trabajo es bastante esforzado ya que se tiene que extraer de cada batería, el señor ya tiene experiencia en este trabajo pero la dificultad que tiene es que no tiene techado el lugar donde el trabaja  y es justamente la causa por que el solicito el crédito para comprar calaminas para techar su lugar de trabajo, el esta casado y trabaja duro para mantener a su familia ya que es el único que trabaja ya que su esposa se dedica a labores del hogar, esta muy agradecido con la institucion por la oportunidad que le brindaron.
texts.en:
Mr. Jesús sells lead, which he extracts from used batteries. He melts it together and sells it at a considerable price, but it is rather difficult work as he has to extract it from each battery. Jesús already has experience with this work, but the difficulty he faces is that he does not have a roof over his workspace. He is requesting this loan in order to buy corrugated metal sheets to add a roof to his workshop. He is married and works hard to sustain his family, as he is the only one who works, while his wife dedicates herself to household tasks. He is very grateful for the opportunity offered to him.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal sheets to add a roof to his workspace

loans.name: Heraclides

texts.es:
Heraclides, de 54 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es vivir una vejez tranquila. Todas las mañanas Heraclides se esmera mucho en trabajar sus tierras y dejarlas muy fértiles, ya que sabe que de eso depende la calidad de su piña, café y plátanos, los cuales posteriormente después de la cosecha llevará a vender al mercado de la ciudad de La Merced.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene mucha libertad para trabajar en sus tierras, lleva 35 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es hacer la limpieza de sus plantaciones de café. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Es el tercer crédito con MFP y se siente en la capacidad de pagar todas sus cuotas, es uno de los miembros más activos en su banco comunal, por eso es muy querido y respetado. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para hacer más fértiles sus tierras.
texts.en:
Heraclides is 54 years old, he is a simple hard-working man. He lives in his own house and what he wishes for the most is to age peacefully. Every morning Heraclides works hard to cultivate his lands and leave them very fertile especially since he knows that the quality of his pineapples, coffee, and bananas will depend on it. He will later take his harvest to the city of La Merced to sell at market. What he likes most about his job is the freedom he has to work his lands. He has been doing it for 35 years and considers the cleaning of his coffee plantations the most difficult. With time, he wishes to purchase new land in order to increase production. This is his third loan with MFP and he feels capable of paying back all of his quotas. He is one of the most active members of the communal bank which is why he is so respected and loved. With the 1,500 peruvian neuvo soles (550 USD) he is requesting, he will purchase more fertilizer to make his land even more fertile.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer to care for his land

loans.name: Shabana's Group

texts.en:
Shabana, with hand raised, is from the small city of Punjab called Kasur, famous for its leather industry. She lives with her family in a three-room brick house where she moved after her marriage to S. A. many years ago. She is a seamstress and sews clothes for neighboring customers. She has a good name in the region due to her ability to produce quality work. She started doing this work five years ago in order to supplement the  family income. Now she receives regular orders every month and earns a good income. Her husband has operated a sweetmeat shop in the market for more than 10 years and has a good reputation for his quality items. Shabana is the mother of two daughters and a son; her eldest daughter is a school teacher and the younger one does embroidery work at home. Her son works in a factory for a monthly wage. They all work to contribute to their family financially. 

Shabana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan her husband will buy items such as milk, sugar, cooking oil and dry fruits in bulk for his sweetmeat business. This will enable him to make sweetmeats in bulk and increasing his sales. She is very confident that her husband will be successful in his business after making this investment in it. 

Shabana is a regular client of Asasah and this is her third loan application. She has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, cooking oil and dry fruits in bulk for his sweetmeat business

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame Aminata Traoré est une femme mariée de 42 ans et mère de 5 enfants qui vit dans une famille monogame avec ses enfants et son époux dans le quartier Hérémakono-Nord de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant vite abandonnée l’école, elle décida de mener des activités génératrices de revenus. Madame Aminata Traoré a tenté plusieurs activités comme l’achat et la vente d’habits, d’articles de fête  etc,  cela sans succès. Alors elle opta de faire de la restauration qu’elle a apprise auprès de sa sœur, depuis maintenant  plus de 8 ans. Son restaurant est situé prêt du grand marché de Bougouni et est très fréquenté.
Après 8 prêts solidaires, elle est venue en individuel où elle est à son 7 ème prêt individuel. Tous les autres prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés sans aucune difficulté. 
Dans le souci de toujours maintenir sa clientèle et d’acquérir de nouveaux, elle continue de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter,  des condiments alimentaires, des poulets,  de la viande, des céréales et quelques petits matériels (cuillères fourchettes, couteau à table, sel de table etc).
Elle s’approvisionne à Bougouni. Sa clientèle a une composition diverse et variée. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 65 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour aider son mari à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata Traoré is a married woman, 42 years of age, with five children. She lives in a monogamous family with her husband and children in the Hérémakonon-North District of the town of Bougouni (the third administrative region of Mali).

After having left school early, she started working to earn a living. Mrs. Aminata Traore tried different business activities such as selling clothing, party supplies etc, without success. And thus she decided to go into a restaurant business, which she has learned from her sister. She has been in business for eight years now. Her restaurant is located next to the big market of Bougouni and is very popular. After eight solidarity loans, she started applying individually and is now on her 7th individual loan. All previous loans have been duly reimbursed without any issues.

With the goal of  retaining her existing customers and attracting new ones, she continues to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso to purchase food condiments, chicken, meat, cereals and some minor items (spoons, forks, knives, table salt etc). She stocks up in Bougouni. Her customer base is very diverse. She plans to achieve a monthly income of 65,000 West African Francs, which will be used to help her husband provide for family needs, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Purchasing restaurant supplies

loans.name: Merlin

texts.en:
Merlin G. is 27 years old, married and supports her family by operating a sari-sari (general) store. She lives in Sitio Tata-an, Brgy. Bato, Toledo City, Cebu. Merlin has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari (general) store, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. Merlin now earns an average monthly income of PHP 2500. Merlin wants to borrow PHP 11000 so that she can  purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 4th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 8000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Merlin aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Joseph Samuel Mwangi

texts.en:
Joseph K., age 34 years, runs a hotel (restaurant) business at Dagoretti, which is a middle-class estate with a good population. He is married to Jane Ngumbi and together they have two grown-up children, a daughter and a son, aged 26 and 18 years. He was introduced to Kadet by an old Kadet client.

Joseph has been running this hotel for one year and his monthly profit is KES 8000. With the loan of KES 40,000 he will buy flour, cooking fat, and charcoal, and pay the salaries of his three employees. If the loan boosts the business, Joseph plans to buy a gas cooker to make cooking faster in his hotel so as not to delay his customers.

Joseph, who describes himself as hardworking, has a dream of buying a piece of land to build rental houses as well as building his own house.

loans.use: To buy flour, cooking fat, and charcoal.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: Felicita, de 44 años de edad, convive con Edgardo, de 50 años. Ambos tuvieron 3 hijos: Joel, de 20, Wilder, de 18 y Gisela de 16 años. Todos en unión familiar, viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). La dedicación que le brida a su trabajo, es muy importante para Felicita, pues gracias al tiempo que pasa en sus cultivos, puede tener una buena cosecha en cada campaña agrícola. Ya tiene 15 años consagrándose en el noble oficio de la agricultura, en todo esté tiempo adquirió muchos conocimientos y se siente feliz por ello. Sus principales cultivos constan de café y plátano; los cuales los vende en su misma localidad, donde después de cada cosecha encajona y vende a los comerciantes mayoristas que llegan los días martes y jueves. Felicita, se siente muy satisfecha por los resultados que está obteniendo; por ello más adelante desea incursionar en el sembrío de más productos, como: Palta y cítricos. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP y agradece todo este tiempo. Pues asegura, que gracias al apoyo de su banco comunal, pudo salir adelante. De adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado comprar, 10 sacos de abono, cuyo valor por unidad oscila entre los noventa soles. Con ello, podrá mantener su producción de café, con una buena calidad.
texts.en:
Felicita, who is 44 years old, lives with Edgardo, who is 50 years old. They have three children together: Joel, who is 20, Wilder, who is 18, and Gisela, who is 16. The family all lives together in their own home in the Puente Paucartambo community (central region of the peruvian rainforest). The dedication she brings to her work is the most important for Felicita, since thanks to the time she spends with her crops, she can have a better harvest in each field. She has been working in the noble field of agriculture for 15 years now. In all this time, she has accumulated much knowledge and she is happy for it. Her principal crops are coffee and plantains, which she sells in the same place, where after each harvest she boxes up and sells to the wholesale customers who come on Tuesdays and Thursdays.

Felicita is very pleased with the results she has obtained. Because of it, she wants to tackle planting more products like avocados and citrus fruits. This is her fifth loan with MFP and she is very grateful. She says that thanks to the support of her community bank, she was able to advance. She plans to use the funds from the loan to purchase 10 sacks of fertilizer, the value of which oscillates around 90 soles. With this fertilizer, she can maintain her coffee production levels, keeping high quality.

loans.use: Purchase 10 sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Savat

texts.en: Mrs. Savat C. (who we see in this photo) is 20 years old and her husband, Mr. Chea Loek, is 26. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, where Mrs. C. stays at home to do housework and raise their newborn infant. Her husband makes a living as a driver. She is applying for a loan to expand her house and add a foundation.

loans.use: To expand her house and add a concrete foundation

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is an 18-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and five siblings. This young man has started working in car mechanics in 2002. And after getting the needed experience, he decided to open his own car repair shop. He repairs all type of cars. This talented man was able to gain a good number of clients. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase mechanic's tools. He wants to complete all tools needed to reinforce his business and be in demand with his clients. In the future, he hopes to expand his business further and sell car spare parts.

loans.use: to purchase mechanic's tools

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony M. is 35 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. Anthony has a furniture shop business, which he has run for three years.
To help expand his business, Anthony has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more timber. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Anthony hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Anthony hopes to be the best in his town at making chairs and tables.

loans.use: To purchase more timber

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
Justo forma parte del banco comunal “La Puerta de la Esperanza” perteneciente a la ciudad de Concepción. Él tiene varios negocios paralelos, ya que todos son esporádicos: vende pescados y mariscos congelados, a otros negocios y clientes particulares. También es carpintero independiente, y además es fabricante de zapatos artesanales. Este último rubro lo aprendió desde hace 17 años, de la familia de su esposa, ya que ellos son zapateros.
Vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 15 y 13 años.
Con este préstamo comparará pescados y mariscos congelados.
Su sueño es comprar una casa, ya que vive en un departamento, que aunque es propio, lo limita para instalarse con algún negocio. Por lo que su meta es vender su departamento para comprar una casa e instalar un minimarket o una panadería, ya que tiene dos hermanos que son panaderos y podrían trabajar con él.
A Justo le han sido muy útiles los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza para la mantención de sus negocios, además le es muy grato compartir con sus compañeros de grupo.
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Biobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
Justo is a member of “La Puerta de la Esperanza” Communal Bank in Concepción. He has several parallel businesses but they are all sporadic. He sells frozen fish and shrimp to other businesses and private customers.  He is also an independent carpenter and manufacturer of handmade shoes.  He learned this last trade 17 years ago from his wife’s family who are shoemakers.  

He lives with his wife and two children who are 15 and 13 years old.  He will buy frozen fish and shrimp with this loan.  He lives in an apartment but his dream is to buy a house. Although he owns his apartment, his ability to set up a business there is limited.  So, his goal is to sell his apartment in order to buy a house and set up a minimarket or a bakery since his two brothers are bakers and would be able to work with him.

The loans from Fondo Esperanza have been very useful to Justo in the maintenance his businesses.  In addition, he is very pleased to share with his partners in the group.

Concepción is situated at the mouth of the Biobío River, (one of the largest in the country), to the south of Chile in the Biobío region.  It has had an important role in the country’s history as a place of important settlement and home to major battles, especially during the Arauco War because of its border with Mapuche territory.  Nowadays, the city is experiencing important economic and demographic development and is becoming considered one of the most important demographic, administrative, financial, and commercial urban centers of Chile, after Santiago and Valparaíso.

loans.use: Frozen fish and shrimp

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es: Fátima Del Rosario tiene 28 años, ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 2 años que inicio este negocio, a pesar de no tener mucha experiencia es una persona que ha sabido salir adelante. Tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, ella estudio administración de empresas pero al  no tener un empleo, decide iniciar su propio negocio. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y aumentar su inventario. Su deseo es seguir obteniendo más ganancias para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Fátima Del Rosario is 28 years old, she sells general goods. She started this business more than 2 years ago, and despite not having much experience she is a person who knows how to get ahead. She has 2 young children in her care. She studied business admininstration but as she did not have a job, she decided to start her own business. She is requesting this financing for working capital and to increase her stock. Her wish is to keep earning more profits to improve her home.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a twenty-eight-year-old married man with two children living in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is into a number of businesses which include maize-growing, brick-laying, and goat selling. His major challenge is price fluctuation of maize and his desire is to have a store of maize. Christopher needs the loan to plant maize.

loans.use: Planting maize

loans.name: Jose Balmore

texts.es:
José de 39 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive con su esposa y dos sobrinos, él se dedica a una panadería, tiene 20 años de existir, prepara el pan todos los días de la semana y su familia le ayuda a atender los clientes y con el oficio que lleva el preparar el pan.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de Harina, azúcar, sal, levadura, estos son los materiales necesarios para la elaboración del pan, con ello José mejorara la producción y atenderá más eficiente a su clientela.
Las aspiraciones de José es mejorar el nivel de ingresos para su familia, tener mayor estabilidad en sus ventas para ofrecer una mejor condición a su hogar.
texts.en:
José is 39 years old and lives in El Tránsito in the Department of San Miguel with his wife and two nephews and nieces. He has a bakery which has been around for 20 years. He makes bread every day of the week and his family helps him to attend to the customers and to prepare the bread.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of flour, sugar, salt, and yeast, as these are the materials he needs to make the bread. With this, José will improve his production and attend to his customers more efficiently.

José’s aspirations are to improve his family’s level of income and to have his sales be more stable in order to provide his household with better conditions.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, salt and yeast

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 27-year-old married man living with his wife. He is from Lebanon. He has been working as a freelance mechanic since 2003. He is specialized in repairing vehicle bodies. At the same time, he works in a local company. In Lebanon, it’s very common to have multiple jobs to be able to pay heavy life expenses. He has taken advantage of a first Kiva loan and has been a reliable client and repaid at his scheduled dates.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional mechanical tools and machineries in order to reinforce his business operation and further develop his work. In the future, he is planning to open his own car repair shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional mechanical tools and machineries

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia es originaria del departamento de Estelí, tiene 56 años de edad, es madre soltera de 5 hijos, ella se levanta cada mañana a vender lotería en las calles de Estelí caminando bajo un incandescente sol recorriendo los barrios  para vender sus billetes de lotería  lleva  mas de 15 años ejerciendo esta actividad de esta manera ha mantenido a sus hijos. Ella comenzó vendiendo 10 billetes de lotería y un talonario de raspaditas ahora vende un poco mas que antes saliendo a venderlos  a las oficinas y algunos clientes  fijos que le compran a ella, buscando nuevos clientes cada día para buscar vender  sus billetes de lotería.
Solicito el crédito para comprar mas billetes de  lotería y raspaditas, esto le ayudara a comprar de contado los billetes y no tener que fiarlas podrá hacer a mas clientes. Desea ahorrar para reparar su vivienda y ponerle piso a su casa. Le gustaría poder vender fuera de Estelí y conseguir un medio de transporte pues ya sus pies están cansados de tanto recorrer pero lo hace por lograr una de sus más anheladas metas que es preparar a sus hijos que están en la universidad.
texts.en:
Silvia is from the Estelí Department and is 56 years old.  She is a single mother with five children.  Each morning she rises and goes out to sell lottery tickets on the streets of Estelí.  Walking in the hot sun she walks thought the various neighborhoods to sell her tickets.  She’s been doing this for 15 years in order to support her children.  She began by selling 10 lottery tickets and a book of scratch off tickets.  Now she sells a bit more than she used to, in offices and to a few steady customers.  She looks for new customers daily.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy more tickets and scratch offs.   This will help her buy to the tickets and not have to buy them on credit.  She can sell to more customers this way.  She wants to save up to make repairs to her home and add a floor.  She would like to sell outside of Estelí and acquire a means of transportation because her feet are tired after so much running around, but she continues to do it in order to accomplish one of her main goals which is preparing her children for a university education.

loans.use: to buy lottery tickets for resale

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS RUMICHACA - ALTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Rumichaca,  provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Ramon; es conviviente, el socio tiene 45 años de edad; y tiene 1 hijo de 17 años de edad; el socio es albañil y trabaja en diferentes obras, el socio siempre esta tras de los trabajos y las constructoras ofreciendo su trabajo, además que es muy trabajador y siempre tiene trabajitos en el año así que él desea en esta oportunidad comprar una maquina mezcladora, esta máquina le permitirá mezclar el cemento con arena y agua, para sacar una masa compacta, el socio requiere el crédito para este fin. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de una maquina mezcladora.

El socio está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Sr. Ramon is a member of the Communal Bank “Manos Juntas Rumichaca-Alta” which is located in the village of Rumichaca in Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

He is 45 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a 17-year-old son. Ramon is a mason and works on different construction jobs. He is always behind in his work, but builders keep offering him jobs. In addition to working hard in his masonry, Ramon also performs odd jobs throughout the year. For this reason, he is taking the opportunity to purchase a cement mixer that will help him combine cement, sand, and water into a compact substance. Ramon is requesting a loan so that he can invest the funds in the purchase of a cement mixer.

He is extremely grateful for the loan and promises to complete his payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase a cement mixer.

loans.name: Twekalangule Musoli Association Group

texts.en: 42 year-old Jesca T. operates a business selling fish from Musoli in the heart of Jinja. The mother of 10 has been engaged in this business for the past decade. Before this business, she was doing mostly farming.  She says hard work has gotten her this far.  She makes a profit from this business of Ugandan shillings 100,000 weekly.  With this loan, she says she is going to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon, aged 24, is a single mother of a 3-year-old child.

She sells curios in Westlands and has been doing this business for one year. The business earns her a monthly income of 30,000 KES.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She will use the loan funds to buy more curios for sale. Sharon hopes to educate her child and improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy curios to sell

loans.name: Lansar Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité LANSAR est créé depuis le 12 mai 2010; il est composé de seize femmes qui habitent ensemble et mènent comme activité principale le petit commerce.



Madame Sarakh la responsable est âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée mère de deux enfants mais a également en charge quatre petits enfants qui sont orphelins de mère. 

Elle mène comme activité principale le petit commerce de légumes et poisson et fait parallèlement de la vente de viande cuite en collaboration avec son mari. Sur la photo, elle est debout à droite habillée d'un sari bleu.


Elle achète ses légumes, poisson, moutons et chèvres au marché hebdomadaire du village et y revend également. Elle a une expérience de 20 ans dans ce domaine.


Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter des moutons et chèvres à abattre pour la cuisson surtout les mercredi qui sont jour de marché hebdomadaire afin de satisfaire la clientèle qui vient de tous les horizons.



Elle souhaite avec ses bénéfices augmenter son épargne et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille pour la nourriture, la scolarité et la santé.
texts.en:
The solidarity group called LANSAR was created on May 12, 2010 and is composed of 16 women who live in the same area and whose principal work is the sale of small items.
