Madame Sarakh, the leader of the group, is 47. She is married and the mother of two children, but is also raising four young children whose mother is deceased.

Her principal activity is selling vegetables and fish. At the same time she sells cooked meat together with her husband. In the photo, she is standing on the right, dressed in a blue sari. 

She buys vegetables, fish, sheep and goats at the weekly market in the village and resells her goods in the same place. She has 20 years' experience in this field. Her loan will allow her to  buy sheep and goats to slaughter and cook,especially on Wednesdays, the weekly market day, so as to satisfy the demand of customers who come from all over. 

She hopes that she can use her profit to grow her savings and improve living conditions for her family in terms of food, school fees, and health-related issues.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fish for resale.

loans.name: Juddie

texts.en:
Juddie is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Juddie has a retail shop that sells several kinds of home & kitchen utensils. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stock of kitchen utensils. 
.
Juddie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Juddie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of kitchen utensils

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a businessman who has been selling sweets, sodas, juice and biscuits for the last four years. He is a hard working and committed 23-year- old businessman.  He is married and a proud father of a three-year-old child. He supplements the earnings from his business with the salary he gets from his employment. He wants 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy sodas for his business.

loans.use: To buy sodas

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 41 years old. He is a quiet, hardworking and focused businessman. He is married and blessed with two children aged three and nine. For the last six years, he has been providing for his family by running a general store. Previously, he was employed as a technician. Peter hopes to open up a supermarket in the next five years. He is requesting a loan of 80,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy sugar, sodas and maize flour and to renovate his shop.

loans.use: to buy sugar, sodas and maize flour, and to renovate his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his car's license plates.

loans.name: Tabara

texts.fr: Madame Tabara  est une commerçante  de 32 ans qui habite au Sénégal. Elle exerce la vente d’huile de palme et de poissons séchés. C’est une activité très favorable  à toutes les périodes de l’année. C’est une dame qui a choisi son activité par nécessité. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis 2 ans. Elle emprunte un montant de 200 000 frs prévu pour le financement de son voyage vers la sous région, un marché hebdomadaire  où  les commerçants  s’approvisionnent en produits locaux. Ce financement lui permettra de renforcer son stock, d’augmenter ses bénéfices et de subvenir a ses  besoins quotidiens et a soutenir ses parents dans leurs charges familiales.
texts.en:
Madame Tabara is a small-scale retailer of 32 who lives in Sénégal. She sells palm oil and dried fish. This is a business that does very well throughout the year. This is a lady who chose her business out of necessity. She has been a member of one of the U-IMCEC branches for two years. 

She is borrowing 200,000 francs with the intention of financing her trip upcountry to a weekly market where retailers stock up on local products. This loan will allow her to expand her stock, increase her profit, and support herself from day to day and help her parents to cover their family expenses.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Rosa Obdulia

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal Bankito Progresista, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es muy visitada por la belleza de su centro colonial, esta bañada por 4 ríos, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones, la gran variedad en su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.
 
Doña Rosa tiene 34 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos  de 15, 14, 12 y 7 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja, dos de sus hijos están estudiando en el colegio y su último hijo está en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como comerciante, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Rosa es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de carnes, negocio en el que lleva 15 años, cuenta con un puesto propio en un mercado de la ciudad, labora en él desde las 5 de la mañana hasta la 3 de la tarde.
 
Se encuentra en su quinto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal  y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de carne para su negocio.

Su sueño es no tener deudas.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Bankito Progresista” (Little Progressive Bank). She lives in Cuenca, which is the most visited city because of the beauty of its colonial center. Cuenca is surrounded by four rivers and its people have maintained their culture and traditions. A large variety of cuisines are available to captivate the taste buds of both locals and foreigners alike.

Doña Rosa is 34 years old, married, and has four children (ages 15, 14, 12, and 7). Her oldest child works, the next two attend high school, and the youngest is enrolled at an elementary school in the city. Her husband works as a merchant. They own the house in which they live.

Sra. Rosa is a merchant who sells all types of meats. She has been in this business for 15 years. Rosa has her own shop at a market in the city. She works from 5am to 3pm.

Rosa is receiving her fifth loan with the Communal Bank. This new loan will be invested in the purchase of meat for her business. Her dream is to not have any debts.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Kanze

texts.en:
Kanze is a married woman with five children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. Kanze dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour and wheat flour for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour and wheat flour for resale.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is married, with one school-aged child. Gina is 38 years old and lives in Silongon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental.
Gina sells choco balls and munchkins to earn a living and has had this business for 1 year. 

She has requested a loan of PHP50,000 to purchase more ingredients needed for her business.  Gina has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Gina hopes to save money for business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients needed for her business

loans.name: Bartola Elizabeth

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Unidas Por Un Futuro Mejor se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Elizabeth, tiene 34 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 16, 15, 13 y 6 años, los mayores estudian en colegio y los menores en escuela. El marido es chofer. 

Doña Elizabeth para ganar algo de dinero y así poder ayudar a su esposo  con los gastos del hogar realiza los quehaceres domésticos en una casa de la localidad, pero adema de esto también se dedica a la venta de ropa, ella después que sale de su trabajo se desplaza por la ciudad visitando  a sus clientes con la finalidad de vender y cobrar los productos que ha entregado, lleva 4 años dedicada a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien, la mercadería ella compra en Guayaquil cada vez que necesita.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 5 ciclos  y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.
 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos
texts.en:
The community bank "Unidas Por Un Futuro Mejor" (United for a better future) meets every fortnight in the Montecristi canton, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture, and for its crafts, which are recognised at a national and an international level. It is also known for its famous straw panama hats. 

This is where Elizabeth lives. She is 34 years of age and lives with her partner with whom she has four children of 16, 15, 13 and 6 years of age. The older children are in high school and the younger children are in primary school. Her husband is a driver. 

Elizabeth works in a home in her neighbourhood as a housekeeper to earn some money and help her husband with the household expenses. She also works selling clothing and visits her customers all over the city to sell clothes and collect payment for delivered orders. She has been working in this field for four years and it is going very well for her. She buys items in Guayaquil anytime she needs to stock up her supplies.

With this loan Elizabeth will buy items including pants, shirts, tops and children's clothing. She has been with the community bank for five loan cycles and she likes to use this service because of the ease with which she can obtain a loan.  

Her dream is to give her children the best opportunities possible.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, tops and children's clothing.

loans.name: José Felipe Santiago

texts.es:
El señor Felipe tiene 26  años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y un hijo.

Él se dedica a la crianza de cerdos desde hace 13 años, sus padres fueron los que le enseñaron esta actividad, de la venta de los cerdos Felipe recibe los ingresos para sostenimiento su familia.

Cada quince días el viaja aun tiangue, para comprar un cerdo pequeño, para esto el tiene que caminar a pie durante treinta minutos hasta un desvió, en donde aborda un autobús que tarda cuarenta y cinco minutos en llegar al tiangue (lugar donde se comercializa con animales). Él regresa a su casa con el cerdo caminando a pie por diez kilómetros aproximadamente desde el tiangue hasta su casa. Luego él se encarga de engordarlos hasta que los vende a un mejor precio.

Don Felipe esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar dos cerditos y comprar concentrado para alimentarlos. De esta forma aumentara el numero cerdos y tendrá alimento para poderlos vender y aumentar sus ingresos, ya que este negocio le es rentable y podrá brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Él planea ahorrar de sus ingresos, para construirle a su familia una casa de adobe, ya que actualmente viven en una casa de bajareque.
texts.en:
Felipe is 26 years of age and lives with his life companion and one son. 

For 13 years, he has worked raising pigs.  His parents were the ones who taught him this trade.  From the sale of the pigs, Felipe receives income to support his family.

Every fifteen days he travels to the livestock market to purchase a small pig.  To do this, he has to walk thirty minutes to a bus stop, where he boards a bus which takes forty-five minutes to arrive to the livestock market (the place where the animals are bought and sold).  He returns home with the pig walking approximately ten kilometers from the market to his house.  Then, he takes charge of fattening the pigs until he can sell them at a better price.

Felipe is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo, in order to purchase two piglets and concentrated feed to nourish them.  In this way, he will increase the number of pigs and will have feed to enable him to sell them and increase his income.  Since this business is profitable, he will be able to offer a better quality of life to his family.

He plans to save his income, in order to build his family an adobe house, since they currently they live in a cane house.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and food to fatten them.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en: Resty lives in Uganda with her husband and four children, one of whom is old enough to attend school. She also cares for her parents and her late sister's children. For the last eight years, she has earned a living by running a retail shop where she works seven days a week. Resty is applying for a loan for 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more items to sell to her customers, including soap, sugar, salt and cooking oil. She supplements the income she earns in her shop by selling second-hand clothing and shoes. Her main challenges are rising prices, slow business during the rainy season and the high cost of transportation. Her goals for the future include owning a wholesale shop and a delivery van. She owns the home she lives in and has access to electricity and piped-in water.  Her major monthly expenses are school fees and food for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Fedeliza

texts.en:
Fedeliza  is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.

Fedeliza has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and rice by the kilogram. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more canned goods, snacks, and rice.

Fedeliza is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and rice

loans.name: Victor Koome

texts.en: Victor Koome 23, is single with no children. He owns a retail shop which has been his business for the last ten years. His business is located in a good conducive environment. Victor is also a farmer. His business is faced with current inflation of goods. He is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to add more stock to his retail shop. He is innovative and energetic.

loans.use: to add more stock.

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en: Bonface is married and blessed with two children and one of them is in school. For the last five years, he has been running Madukani Cereals, a general store that sells products such as cereals, bathing soap, washing soap and other household products, in order to support his family. He is also employed to earn extra income. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings in order to buy maize, beans, rice and peas and other products to resell. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business and convert his shop into a company. Bonface expresses gratitude to Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, since he has been able to access a loan to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans, rice and peas and other products to sell.

loans.name: Khasiro Group

texts.en:
Benson is the facilitator of the Khasiro group. Benson and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Benson takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Benson had a very good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Benson was only able to harvest six bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Benson and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Benson will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Khasiro group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Withiakh Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 09 JUILLET 2002. Il  est  constitué de quinze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Ndike qui est à la gauche de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 63 ans. Elle est veuve et mère d'un enfant. Elle a aussi en sa charge six autres enfants confiés par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de bouillie de mil, de patates et de beignets. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu’elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’augmenter son approvisionnement en mil et de renforcer ses épargnes.
texts.en:
Withiakh Group was created in solidarity on July 9, 2002. It consists of 15 women who live in the same neighborhood. Their main business is shopkeeping.

Madam Nidike who is on the left of the photo raising her hand is responsible for the group. She is 63 years old. She is a widow and mother to one child. She also takes care of six other children entrusted to her by her parents.

She actively sells mil [a type of cereal] gruel, potatoes and doughnuts. She is well experienced in this business domain, where she has been working for several years.

This loan will allow her to strengthen her captial and to better develop her businesses.

The profits will allow her to increase her stock of mil and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy mil [a type of cereal], flour, and potatoes.

loans.name: Divaajur

texts.en:
Mr. Diivaajur, 42 is a transportation driver of a private company. He started his job this year in this company and has been driving for many years. Diivaajur lives with his son and wife in the ger district, the nomadic Mongolian traditional tent in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 
Last fall, he started building his own house beside his ger and still could not finish it due to lack of money. Specifically, he needed to purchase some necessary building materials to complete the building. He wants to finish it before this winter and now he just needs to complete some parts such as windows, doors and wall insulation. Therefore he will be using his loan to purchase the building materials necessary to finish building his new house.

loans.use: To purchase the building materials necessary for his new house.

loans.name: Rosalind

texts.en:
Rosalind is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 4 children. 

Rosalind has a food shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 4 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Rosalind has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rosalind hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Adama Group

texts.en:
Adama is the leader of this group. She was born in Makeni city, twenty-nine years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple has two children who are attending primary school. Adama sells women’s dresses, “Bamako cloth” (cloth made in Mali), shoes, body lotions, etc.  Adama has been doing business for five years now.

With the help of this loan, Adama will be able to expand her business, make more sales and consequently improve her living conditions. She will use her share of the loan (1,000,000 SLL) to buy women’s clothes including Bamako cloth, body lotions, shoes, etc. in larger quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy women’s clothes, body lotions and shoes in larger quantities to add to her business.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José de 23 años, vive en compañía de sus padres: Adán y Armanda. Tiene un hermano menor de 13 años a quien educa con el ejemplo. Juntos viven en una casa de propiedad de la familia, ubicada en la localidad de Palcamayo – Tarma. José es un buen hijo. Vio que sus padres se cansaban mucho en el trabajo del campo, y por eso decidió ayudarlos. Hace 3 años que se dedica a la agricultura y administra muy bien las ventas de sus productos. “Mis padres están mejor cuando yo me hago cargo de la chacra (terrenos de cultivos)”. Es por eso que emprendió sus sembríos de espinaca, alverja y flor de gladiolo, en terrenos propios y arrendados. Ya que necesita aprovechar las diferentes temporadas agrícolas.
José viaja con constancia hacia la ciudad de Lima, llevando sus productos y vendiéndolos al por mayor en el mercado de su ciudad. Sus padres solo se dedicaban a la producción, pero él los animó a salir de Tarma para buscar mejores ingresos; y les va muy bien.
Este joven enérgico, trabaja en lo que se le presente. “Hago de todo, a veces trabajo como peón en la chacra o en construcción”, dice sonriente. Con esa voluntad quiere adquirir un terreno propio para independizarse. Éste sería su crédito número 3 que recibiría de MFP, por eso se responsabiliza de pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón San Cristóbal”, dice sentirse a gusto con personas emprendedoras como él. Con el dinero podrá compra las semillas necesarias de espinacas que sembrará en este mes. Lo sobrante lo destinará en la compra de bolsas de abonos orgánicos.
texts.en:
José, 23, lives with his parents, Adán and Armanda.  He has a 13 year old brother who he educates through his example.  They live together in a house belonging to the family located in Palcamaya-Tarma.  

José is a good son.   He saw how tired his parents became working in the fields so he decided to help them.  He’s been farming for three years and handles the sale of his products very well.  “My parents are better when I take charge of the “chacra” (farmland).”  This is why he started planting spinach, peas and gladioli on his own and on leased land because he needs to take advantage of the various farming seasons.

José travels constantly to the city of Lima taking his products and selling them at the wholesale market.  His parents used to just farm but he encouraged them to go beyond Tarma to seek better income and they are doing very well.

This energetic young man works at whatever comes up.  “I do a bit of everything; sometimes I work as a day laborer in the fields or in construction,” he says smiling.  With that willingness he wants to buy a piece of land of his own in order to become independent.

This would be loan #3 he gets from MFP so he takes on the responsibility of being punctual with his monthly installment payments.  He belongs to the “Patrón San Cristóbal” (Patron Saint Christopher) communal bank and he says that he feels comfortable with enterprising people like him.

With the money he will be able to buy the necessary spinach seeds he’ll plant this month.  Any remainder will be used to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.use: to buy spinach seeds and sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Benefit Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Benefit” group from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 800,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Salamatu is the leader of this group. The 40-year-old is married to a monthly salaried worker and they have 4 children. Salamatu has been a businesswoman for 28 years now. She sells gara lappers (locally dyed cloths) and has been in this business for 28 years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy materials to produce a large quantity of gara lappers, such as ink, caustic soda, powder, and white cotton cloths.

loans.use: to buy materials to produce a large quantity of gara lappers (locally dyed cloths), such as ink, caustic soda, powder, and white cotton cloths.

loans.name: Jose Rosendo

texts.es:
José, vive con su compañera de vida y dos hijos, con edades de tres y un años, él tiene en total tres personas dependientes, su fuente de ingresos es cultivar maíz, el producto lo vende en elote, jilote y en grano, ya tiene 6 años de contar con su negocio, lo desarrolla con la ayuda de dos empleados, su ventaja es que ya tiene clientes  que le compraran el producto y  después lo venderán en el mercado, no representa dificultades y heredo el oficio de su familia.
Invertirá en abono, semilla de maíz, insecticidas y herbicidas, otra parte le servirá para pagar los costos de preparación del terreno en el que piensa sembrar, al tener insumos agrícolas a su disposición espera sembrar en el tiempo justo y darle un buen trato a sus cultivos, su riesgo son las plagas que se desarrollan en la temporada.
Su visión es tener un negocio estable que le permita diversificar más sus cultivos para atender a otro tipo de cliente.

loans.use: Invertirá en abono, semilla de maíz, insecticidas y herbicidas, otra parte le servirá para pagar los costos de preparación del terreno en el que piensa sembrar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur is a very active and responsible man. 5 years ago he decided to start a small business. This business has allowed his family to have a better income. He is 25, married, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, settled in Khirdalan settlement. The first time he borrowed a loan of $400 and bought agricultural produce.
The second time he borrowed $1000 and bought scales and  made shelves.
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to expand the area of his place in the market.
Zaur has sold agricultural produce in the Khirdalan market for 5 years.

loans.use: Sale of agricultural produce

loans.name: Filiga

texts.en: Filiga is a long-running and successful member of the SPBD Program in her small village.  She is married and has six children.  She runs a business selling cooked food in front of her house every Saturday.  Filiga bakes yams, taro, and bananas on hot stones and sells five pieces wrapped in foil for ST 5 (about USD 2) to local villagers.  Each Saturday, she is able to bring in revenues of about ST 100 – 200 (about USD 40 – 80).  She is confident in the demand for her product, and she would use an additional loan to buy ingredients and food packaging.

loans.use: Buy ingredients and packaging

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela is married and her husband works in construction. They have two sons. She began her business in order to help support her husband with family expenses. Since she only has a primary school education she was unable to secure a job. She therefore dedicated herself to selling beauty products through catalogs and subsequently added shoes and clothing sales. She has had her business for 5 years and is hoping to continue to expand it in order to improve the quality of life for her sons since with only the salary of her husband they are unable to achieve this.

Graciela is asking for a loan of $200 in order to purchase more products to satisfy the demand of her clients as well as have products in stock to be able to show her clients firsthand what they are purchasing rather than have them simply rely on the catolog. She is hoping to repay this loan in 3 months. She is very thankful for the support you are bringing to her.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Graciela esta casada y su esposo trabaja como albañil, ellos tienen dos hijos, ella empezó su negocio debido a que necesitaba ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares y ella no solo tener estudios de primaria completos no pudo conseguir ningún empleo por ello se dedicó a la venta por catálogo de artículos de belleza y posteriormente fue incluyendo en sus ventas zapatos y ropa, ella tiene con su negocio 5 años y espera continuar creciendo y poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, ya que con solo el sueldo de su esposo no les alcanza.

Graciela está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 200 para comprar mercadería y poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes así como tener algo de stock para que sus clientes puedan apreciar los productos de manera directa y no solo por el catálogo, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses. Ella te acrece el apoyo que le brindas para poder lograr sus metas.

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is married with four children, all of whom have already married. Her husband is retired and their income cannot cover all of their household expenses. So two years ago on a friend's recommendation Yolanda started her business selling cosmetics through a catalog. Her first clients were family and friends and now through word of mouth she has a growing clientele that requests a lot of cosmetic products. With her business Yolanda now can bring home the extra income necessary that's needed to improve she and her husband's quality of life.

Yolanda is applying for a US$475 loan to buy products for her clients' pending orders, thus keeping her clients and maintaining a good reputation for future recommendations.

Yolanda and her husband are grateful for the support you give in helping her continue and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

Yolanda es una mujer casada y tiene 4 hijos los cuales todos a la fecha están casados, su esposo es una persona jubilada y por lo tanto sus ingresos no cubren el gasto familiar, motivo por el cual ella tuvo que iniciar con su negocio de venta de cosméticos por catálogo, el cual inició hace dos años por recomendación de una amiga. Sus primeros clientes eran sus amistades y familiares, ahora ella ya tiene una clientela la cual ha se ha ido incrementando por recomendación de otros clientes, y le solicitan muchos productos, con su negocio Yolanda ahora puede traer el ingreso extra al hogar que le hace falta para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su esposo.

Yolanda está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 475 para poder surtir los pedidos pendientes que tiene de sus clientes y así poder retenerlos y quedar bien para mejores referencias, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su esposo agradecen el apoyo que le brindas para poder continuar con su negocio y crecer con el mismo.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her stock.

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.en:
Emperatriz is a true renaissance woman! She’s currently involved in four different businesses. Her primary business is selling food; she prepares anticuchos (shish kabobs), salchipapas (sausage with fries), hamburgers, and other foods and sells them, along with soft drinks, from a stand outside of her home. She sells the food from 7:00 to 11:00 am. As a second business, she buys toys wholesale and sells them as Christmas presents.

Emperatriz also sells cosmetics for a company called Esika, similar to Mary Kay or Avon, and this has lead her to her true passion- cosmetology. She is currently studying cosmetology three days a week, for five hours a day. She finishes in December and will be ready to practice, which she plans to do from her home, however she would love to study an additional six months to become trained in manicures and pedicures as well. Her dream is to open a beauty salon, but she also wants to continue with her other businesses—she realizes to do this she might need to hire some help!

Emperatriz has two children, ages 17 and 9. Her oldest just finished high school and is now preparing for college. With this loan of $125 Emperatriz will buy ingredients for her food stand, such as potatoes and meat, as well as toys to sell for Christmas.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her food stand

loans.name: Mukaddam

texts.en: Mukaddam I. lives in B.Gafurov, Tajikistan; she is married and has 4 children. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007, and she recommends herself as a serious executive client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. She is engaged in commercial and trade service. Mrs. I. is engaged in the business of  selling children's clothing. She has a wide assortment and  works with customers of different income levels. She is very polite, which is why she has repeat clients who want to buy only her goods. She is very experienced in the business. But she has stiff competition in the sector, which is why she wants to provide a wider assortment of new goods. Now Mrs. I. requests a loan of 1,400 TJS (US$425) to import new styles  to develop the existing business. She wants to widen the business to increase her family income, which allows her children to get a good education.

loans.use: to import new clothing styles for business development

loans.name: Kigombya A(I) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Florence is 38 years old and married with four children. She sells African crafts for a living. With the increased business profits, she intends to pay school fees for her children and re-invest in her business. Justine sells new clothes and wants to use the loan to increase her stock. Federesi sells local brew. Hawa has a retail shop, while Rose sells raw food in the market.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand the group's businesses

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor O. is a 39 year-old married father of four. For the past 12 years, Victor has run a small shop, located in an auto repair yard, selling spare car parts. He is requesting $525 to buy additional spare car parts for sale.

Victor is also a member of a lending group called “Wisdom Group”, which consists of 14 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy additional spare car parts.

loans.name: Sovannathou

texts.en:
Mr. Sovannathou and his wife have been married for twenty one years. They have three children—one son and two daughters. Two of their children are employed full time and other one is in school. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. S. has been selling watches for fifteen years. He buys them from the market in Phnom Penh for resale in Treng Trayoeng Market (Kam Pong Spoe Province). His wife has been a garment factory worker for five years.

Mr. S. is requesting a loan for the first time. He is asking for $1000 to purchase watches for resale.

loans.use: To purchase watches for resale

loans.name: Purificacion

texts.es:
Mrs. Purificacion R. D. R. is a member of the « Las Victorias » Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martín region, province of Mariscal Cáceres, in the district of Juanjui. Her business is located in her home on Jr. Loreto Nº 111, where she sells groceries, office and school supplies.

With the support of her husband and her children, she has managed to increase her business considerably, securing many clients.

With a loan of $575.00 that she will repay in 6 months, she will buy rice, sugar, milk, oil, detergents, soaps, and general cleaning supplies along with soft drinks, and various snacks among other things to supply her business and meet the demands of her customers.

Purificacion is 50-years-old and she works hard every day to meet the goals she has set for herself. In the future, she hopes to expand her store.

Translated from Spanish by Amani R., Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Purificacion R. D. R. es socia del Banco Comunal “ Las Victorias” vive en la región D. San Martín provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres , distrito D. Juanjui , su negocio esta ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Loreto Nº 111 y se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes, artículos D. oficina y útiles escolares Con el apoyo D. su esposo y sus hijos, ha logrado que el negocio se incremente considerablemente, logrando fidelizar gran cantidad D. clientes. Con el crédito recibido D. S/.1500.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: arroz, azúcar en bolsas , leche, aceite, en cajas, detergentes, jabones y útiles D. limpieza en general, gaseosas, golosinas diversas, entre otros, para surtir su negocio y cubrir la demanda D. su basta clientela. La señora Purificacion tiene 50 años, se esfuerza cada día por lograr cumplir con sus metas trazadas, desea para el futuro ampliar su bodega.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her general store.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Kiên is 49 years old. She is a participating member of TYM since 2003. She has had 5 rounds of loans already. She uses all her loans to buy sedge to weave mats. Her family living condition has considerably improved: she has been able to buy the goods for her household including a tv set. Since this type of business brings her cash flow, it makes it easy for her to make the weekly payment. Her income is around 250 USD a month. She also produces sedge herself on her own field. This is why she has to renew the soil once in a while. This time she is requesting 500 USD to buy sedge and fertilizer for her field.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Kiên, 49 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2003. Qua 5 vòng vốn vay, hầu hết chị Kiên đều đầu tư mua cói dệt chiếu. Kinh tế gia đình phát triển rõ rệt, chị Kiên đã mua sắm được ti vi, tủ cùng nhiều đồ đạc trong gia đình. Việc hoàn trả của chị cũng rất thuận lợi nhờ có thu nhập thường xuyên. Trung bình một tháng chị Kiên thu được 250USD từ bán chiếu. Để có nguyên liệu tốt làm chiếu thì sau 1 vài vụ thu hoạch phải cải tạo lại đất, đầu tư chăm bón. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 500USD để cải tạo đồng cói và đầu tư chăm bón. Bên cạnh đó chị cũng mua cói làm nguyên liệu dệt.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, sedge

loans.name: Vanna Phet Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Mrs Vanna P.. She is a state teacher in Soben Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. This job generates only $25 per month, which is not enough to support a family. Her husband, Mr Samorn P., is a farmer and rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and sell at a better price later in the year. Since Mrs Vanna P.'s husband's business has improved, Mrs Vanna P. wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs Vanna P. asked for a loan to purchase more rice to keep in stock. Mrs Vanna P. has two children, both of whom are attending the local school.

Previously, Mrs Vanna P. obtained a loan from AMK to start her husband's middleman business. She will share this loan with her group members.

loans.use: To buy rice to keep in stock and sell at a better price later in the year.

loans.name: Kossiwavi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Kossiwavi T. was born in Pya-Lao in 1969. She is married and responsible for 3 children. Coming from a poor family, she did not have a chance to pursue her studies. On the other hand, her parents taught her how to make charcoal. Since she now lives in Lomé, she no longer makes it, but buys it in the village at a lower price to re-sell in Lomé. She began this business in the year 2000.

To transport her merchandise all the way to Lomé, Mrs. T. hires a truck which is becoming more and more expensive. She would therefore like to increase her inventory to lessen the transport charges and she is requesting this first loan to purchase 15 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame T. Kossiwavi est née à Pya-Lao en 1969. Elle est mariée et a 3 enfants à la charge. Issue d’une famille pauvre elle n’a pas eu la chance de faire des études. Par contre ses parents lui ont appris à faire du charbon de bois. Etant donné qu’elle est basée maintenant à Lomé elle n’en fabrique pas mais elle en achète dans son village à prix réduit et elle revend à Lomé. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis l’an 2000.

Pour transporter sa marchandise jusqu’à Lomé, madame T. fait appel au camion transporteur qui revient de plus en plus chère. Elle a donc pensé augmenter son stock pour amoindrir la charge et sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 15 sacs de charbons de bois.

loans.use:
Purchase of 15 sacks of charcoal

Achat de 15 sacs d charbons de bois

loans.name: Mr. Chuob Choeurn Group

texts.en: This group is located in Preak Ta Ong Ti Pie Village in Kandal Province and consists of four people. Mr. Chuob C. is the group leader. He is a motorbike taxi driver who makes a small income to support his family. His wife, Mrs. PH. Nop is a mat maker. Since her business is going well and she also has a lot of customers, she has decided to expand her business. Unfortunately, she does not have enough money to purchase more raw materials to make a mats so her husband, Mr. Chuob C., would like to request a loan for this purpose. Mr. Chuob C. is 50 years old and the father of four children one of whom is working as a security guard Company while another one helps Mrs. PH. Nop's business. The remaining two are attending school.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make mats to sell.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Maria Teresa tiene 30 años de tener un negocio de venta de comida, cuando comenzó lo tenia cerca del mercado del municipio, ahora cuenta con un local propio y mejor ubicado. 

Ella no ha tenido el apoyo de mi esposo, y  siempre me ha defendido sola.  Comenta que ha tenido decepciones en la vida, pero gracias a Dios siempre  ha salido adelante.  Les ha brindado sus estudios a sus 6 hijos, 5 ya están casados, y uno que aun le ayuda en el negocio.

Durante todo el tiempo que ella ha tenido su negocio, se ha ganado el respeto de toda la gente.  Ahora tiene más pedidos de comida para desayunos  y almuerzos.  Este préstamo lo solicita para comprar más ollas, una estufa más grande, mesas,  sillas y utensilios de cocina, así como para comprar un mostrador para poner mis utensilios de cocina.

Ella agradece mucho el apoyo que se le brinda.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa has had a business selling food for 30 years, when she started it was located close to the municipal market, now she has her own locale in a better location.

She didn't have the support of her spouse and she has always taken care of herself. She says that she has had disappointments in life, but thank God she has always been able to overcome them. She has provided an education to her 6 children, 5 of whom are now married, and one that still helps her with the business.

During all the time she has had her business, she has earned the respect of those around her. Now she has more orders for breakfast and lunch meals. This loan she seeks will be used to buy more pots, a larger stove, talbes, chairs, and kitchen utensils, and also to buy a counter to put her kitchen utensils.

She is very thankful for the support she receives.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy kitchen utensils, a larger stoves, tables, chairs, and a counter.

loans.name: Ameen's Group

texts.en:
Ameen baji is the wife of M. and lives in an area named Riwind in the city Kasur, Pakistan. She has been living in this area for the last 10 years. She is the mother of five children: two sons and three daughters. Her elder daughter reads in 9th standard. The next to her is in 7th standard. Her younger daughter is in kindergarten. Both of her sons are in 3rd standard. Ameen baji's husband runs a grocery shop. Ameen baji is a housewife and also sews clothes of her neighbors. She successfully repaid her four loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more groceries for her husband's grocery shop.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Bilquis baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Sharifan baji wants a loan to buy more clothes to resell. Noor baji also wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
Mrs. Shimorn O. is a villager in Preak Thom village in Kandal Province. She is a clothes seller. She is a widow and the mother of one son who is a security guard. 

Now she faces an obstacle because her house is so old and she does not earn much money to support herself. Thus, Mrs. Shimorn O. decided to ask for a loan to repair her house.

loans.use: To repair her house to be better than before.

loans.name: Loung

texts.en:
Mr. Loung C., 46, and his wife, Mrs. Mao Kong, 41, live in the suburb of Phnom Penh City. They were married in 1985 and have nine children: five sons and four daughters. One of them was married and lives outside the family home, three children are garment factory workers, two children are tailors, one has full-time employment, and two children attend school.

Mr. Loung has been a tailor for two years, a skill he learned from his neighbor. His wife has been selling vegetables for about five months. Currently, he wants to create another business running a Tuk Tuk (motorbike taxi). Therefore, he is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase one motor taxi to earn more income to support his family.

loans.use: To purchase one motor taxi (Tuk Tuk).

loans.name: Umri

texts.en: H. Umri is 48-years old and the loving mother of three children. The elder son is already a student and the younger children are starting school. Umri and her husband dream  that their children will have a higher education. She sells meat products like sausages, boiled sausage, frankfurter, and dairy products such as cheese, butter, mayonnaise, etc. She has been in this business for 5 years. Umri is a very polite and cheerful woman by her nature. She has regular customers who buy in bulk, which allows her to have a stable income for her family. Umri is requesting a loan of $ 1000 USD. She is planning to purchase a greater variety of meat products in order to meet her client’s demands. She expects to repay the loan in 12 months. Umri sincerely thanks all the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy meat products and provide a greater variety of goods.

loans.name: Kankélentigui (Qui Teint Parole) Group

texts.fr:
Les huit (08) membres du groupe Kankélentigui ont en moyenne 49ans et vivent majoritairement dans des familles monogamiques avec en moyenne 5 enfants à Markala (quatrième région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers  des liens de voisinage dans le quartier Rail Ko de Diamarabougou. Elles font essentiellement l’achat et la vente des céréales, du bois de chauffe et des condiments. D’autres font de temps à autre de la restauration.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin leurs clientèles les femmes du groupe Kankélentigui ont décidé d’adhérer le programme crédit de l’institution avec laquelle elles sont à leur 4ème prêt, après avoir bien remboursé les trois prêts précédents.
Elles comptent utiliser ce nouveau prêt pour acheter, 4 cartons de  concentrée de tomate, 4 sacs de sel iodé, 25kg de Soumbala, 2 cartons de cubes maggi, 2 sacs de choux pommés, 2 sacs de pomme de terre, 34 poulets et 37 kg de poisson frais. Parfois elles vendent aussi du bois de chauffe à domicile. Elles se ravitaillent en condiments à Markala une fois par semaine à la foire, en poulet à Dougabougou et parfois sur place à Markala ; en poisson frais au bord du fleuve Niger. Les produits sont vendus au marché de Diamarabougou et dans des gargotes aménagées à domicile,  au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 37 000FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et la prise en charge des fournitures scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
The eight members of the Kankélentigui group have an average age of 49 and mostly live in monogamous families with on average 5 children in Markala (fourth administrative region of Mali). They know each other because they are related to each other and live in the community of Rail Ko of Diamarabougou. They essentially buy and sell cereals, firewood, and condiments. Others sell cooked food from time to time.

With the intention of satisfying their clientele, the women of the Kankélentigui group decided to join the loan program of the institution with whom they are on their 4th loan, after having reimbursed the three preceding ones.

They intend to use this new loan to buy 4 cases of tomato paste, 4 sacks of iodized salt, 25 kg of "Soumbala" (a condiment), 2 cases of Maggi cubes, 2 sacks of cabbages, 2 sacks of potatoes, 34 chickens, and 37 kg of fresh fish. Sometimes they also sell firewood out of their homes. They buy their condiments in Markala once a week at the fair, their chickens come from Dougabougou or are bought right in Markala; their fresh fish is bought on the banks of the Niger River. The products are sold at the market of Diamarabougou and out of sheds set up at their homes, for cash and on credit to a clientele composed of women and men. They hope to make an average profit of 37,000 F CFA per month which will be used to make repayments on the loan and to pay their children's school fees.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of condiments and other articles, among them items for food service

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is a sari-sari store owner (a community-based store) in her village.  She is glad that she is able to earn a weekly income of PHP1,000 that they use for their basic needs.  According to her, financial difficulties have hindered her from improving her business, so she decided to ask for a loan of PHP 5,000 as business capital.  Aside from increasing her merchandise, she is also planning to buy a piglet and start in hog-raising for extra income.  She hopes that her loan will be granted and that she will become really successful someday.  

She is 35 years old and married to Gerry, who works as a welder and "tricycle" (local three-wheeled vehicle) driver in their village.  The couple was blessed with two children: Dennis Jayvee - 9 years old and Reina Grace - 8 years old; both are in elementary level.

loans.use: Buy additional merchandise and a piglet

loans.name: Yessica Katia,

texts.es:
Ocho años es el tiempo que Yesista lleva trabajando en una librería dentro de la Universidad La Cantuta, en Chosica. Hasta hace un tiempo también se encargaba de vender cosméticos por catálogo como titular, sin embargo una socia la estafo y decidió abandonar el negocio. Hoy en día ha vuelto a vender cosméticos pero solo eventualmente y a través de otra persona. 

A sus treinta y tres años, Jessica, sueña con poder estudiar la carrera de Administración alguna vez para poder manejar una empresa propia. Por ahora se contenta al ver a su hijo estudiar en un colegio poli técnico donde toma clases de gestión empresarial. Además de su hijo de quince años, tiene a uno de siete. Ambos son su principal motivo de trabajo. 

Junto con su esposo, quien trabaja como mantenimiento en la misma universidad que ella, se ocupa de los gastos del hogar y de sus hijos.
texts.en:
For 8 years Yessica has been working at a bookstore at the University La Cantuta in Chosica. For a while she also ran a business selling cosmetics from a catalog. However, a business partner swindled her and she decided to abandon the business. Recently she has decided to begin selling cosmetics again but only occasionally and through another person. At 33 years old, Yessica dreams of being able to take courses in management so that she can run her own business. For now she is content to see her son study at a polytechnic school where he takes classes in business management. Besides her fifteen year old son, she also has a seven year old. They are her principal motivation to work. Together with her husband, who works maintenance at the same university as her, they work to pay for the household expenses and expenses related to their children.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for the school expenses of her two children

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Gratitud.
Juana es casada, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Juana junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de libros referidos al tema de derecho, su local esta ubicado en una calle céntrica de la ciudad, el cual es alquilado.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de libros diversos.
Juana sueña con mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Gratitud Community Bank. She is 34, is married and has 2 children.

With her husband, she sells law books in a rented store in the city centre.

She needs a loan of 1000 sol to buy books. Juana's dream is to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy books

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort sells cooked food in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria to make a living. She is 45 years old and married with six children. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to expand her business.

She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Marta

texts.en: Mrs. Marta T. is a resident of Dapitan City, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and blessed with 10 kids. Out of the 10, only one is still studying. She is an active member of Paglaum Co-op, a Kiva partner. She engages in raising pigs to help her husband, who is a farmer. Now she seeks a loan in the co-op for 5,000 Ph intended to purchase feed for her pig with the hope that it will grow faster for the education of her child.

loans.use: Purchase feed

loans.name: Christ Roi Plus Group

texts.fr: Evelyne A. a comme activité commerciale, une terrasse. Elle a commencé à exercer le commerce depuis 1994 en vendant 4 futs d’huile de palme qui lui ont procuré un capital propre de $700 en 1997.  En 1998, elle tentât de vendre des habits usagers qu’elle abandonna la même année suite à l’échec. Elle se décida ainsi de se lancer jusqu’aujourd’hui dans la vente des boissons. Comme ses clients ne cessent de croitre et dans le souci d’accroitre le revenu, Evelyne a planifié d’acheter avec le crédit de mois de mai courant, 9 casiers de boissons sucrées pour satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle. Actuellement, son capital propre est de $150 et son activité lui procure un bénéfice de $60 par semaine. Son ambition est d’ouvrir un dépôt des boissons. Elle est devenue membre fidèle de l’un des groupes de Hope depuis décembre 2008. Evelyne est mariée et mère de 7 enfants âgés entre de 7 à 23 ans dont tous étudient.
texts.en:
Evelyne A. has a terrasse as her business. She started this business in 1994 by selling four drums of palm oil that gained her $700 in capital in 1997. In 1998, she tried selling second-hand clothing but abandoned that business the same year following its failure. She then decided to get started in the sale of beverages and does so today. Since her customers are ever-growing in number, and having concerns about increasing her revenues, Evelyne has planned to use the loan of this May to buy nine cases of sweet beverages to satisfy her customers. Currently, her capital is at $150, and her business brings in a profit of $60 per week. Her ambition is to open a beverages outlet. She has become a loyal member of a HOPE group since December 2008. Evelyne is married and the mother of seven children, ranging in age from 7 to 23 years, who are all students.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nine cases of sweet drinks to resell in order to grow her revenues

loans.name: Nasreen Muhammad Ishaq Group

texts.en:
Abida baji wants a loan to buy vehicle spare parts to sell. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her dairy business. 

Nasreen baji is a widow and has been a citizen of a city named Lahore, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. Her husband died in an accident. Nasreen baji became unstable after the death of her husband but she plucked up her courage for her kids, two sons and one daughter. She started a business sewing clothes for her kids so that they can continue their studies. Nasreen baji is applying for a loan to buy an electric sewing machine so that she gets more orders and completes them on time. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine for sewing clothes

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en: Caridad L. is from the village of Biasong. She is 46 years old, widowed, and has three adult children. Caridad owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Caridad joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Caridad is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Galka

texts.ru: Бобоева Галка проживает в районе Явана. Возраст 50 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Галка имеет торговую точку, где торгует разными мелочами. Например: Жвачаки, семечки, конфеты и т.д. Муж подрабатывает на стройке. Кредит, просит для закупа семечек и внести в ассортимент арбуз и кукурузу.
texts.en:
Galka B. lives in the Yavan district. She is 50 years old, married and has 5 children. Galka has a retail stand where she sells various small items, such as chewing gum, seeds, candy, etc. Her husband works part-time at a construction site. She is requesting a loan to purchase seeds and to add watermelons and corn to her product assortment.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing assortment

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор Уракова проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 33 года. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Гулбахор имеет торговую точку на рынке, где сама же торгует овощами. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 10 лет. Муж также помогает супруге. Он занимается перевозкой товара. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборта.
texts.en:
Glubakhor U. is 33-years-old , lives in Rumi District, and is married with 4 children. She has a shop at the market, where she herself sells vegetables. She’s been in this type of business for 10 years. Her husband, who transports goods for a living, also helps her out. She plans to use her loan to increase her sales.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses K. is 44 years old and a married father of four children. He lives in Changamwe, in coast province. Moses owns one motorbike which he uses for passenger service. He has been in business for the last two years.

This marks Moses' first borrowing from KADET and he plans to top up the money with his own savings and purchase a new motorbike.

Moses intends to expand his transport business by acquiring a nissan matatu in future.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Hydee

texts.en:
Hydee is a hog raiser. She is 36 years old, married to Romeo Jr., and lives in Calao East, Santiago City.

Hydee dreams of uplifting their family from poor living conditions through her business. This is the reason why she wants to request a loan of PHP 4,000 from Kiva lenders to buy a stock of feed so she can sustain the needs of her hogs. She is also hoping to have a bigger piggery business someday. 

The couple is blessed with three children: the twins - 18-year-old high school graduates and Jamiaca - a 12-year-old high school student.

loans.use: To buy a stock of pig feed

loans.name: Odile

texts.fr: O. Odile est mariée et mère d’un enfant. La famille réside depuis onze ans à Davatin dans la commune de Sèmè kpodji. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Odile vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. C'est les layettes que Odile vend de façon ambulante. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Odile achète ses articles. Odile a déjà trois ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Odile a eu trois crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour continuer à développer son activité, Odile demande un quatrième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Achat de vêtements pour enfants.

loans.name: Ofugho

texts.en: Ofugho is a 30 year old married woman with a child.She has been working as a commercial-based tailor since 2004 to earn income to satisfy the needs of her child and husband.She is requesting for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase tailoring materials to meet the requirement of her customers and make good income.She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe V. is from the village of Inobulan, Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 47 years old. Cleofe is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Cleofe operates a variety store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of foods and daily-use products in the local community. Cleofe has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,009 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cleofe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cleofe is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Cleofe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Denis

texts.es:
Denis es un joven muy jovial de 21 años que vive en la casa de sus padres.
A pesar de su juventud él sabe usar muy bien su tiempo, ya que desde las 8 de la mañana trabaja en sus cultivos de café, los cuales sembró cuando tenía 18 años en las chacras que sus padres que le cedieron; pero también apoya a sus padres con sus chacras de plátanos, ya que esos cultivos le recuerdan una bonita infancia. 
Denis quiere tener una economía independiente a la de su padre, por ello que quiere realizar otro vivero de café en un espacio del terreno de sus padres, y de ese modo vender una cierta cantidad de plantitas de café y la otra parte trasplantarlas a su chacra.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y pese a ser el menor de todos los integrantes de su banco comunal, es quien pone el orden, pues es el fiscal de grupo, además de ser el primero en llegar a cada reunión. Con el dinero que solicita va a comprar semillas de café para realizar su vivero, así como fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Denis is a cheerful, 21-year-old, young man who lives with his parents. Despite his youth, he knows how to use his time very well since he works his coffee plantings, which he planted when he was 18 years old, from 8 in the morning. He planted them in a farm his parents gave him but he also helps his parents with their banana plantings since those crops remind him of a happy childhood. Denis wants to be economically independent from his father and that's why he wants to set up another coffee plant nursery on a space available on his parents' farm. He would like to then sell some of his plants and transplant the others to his farm. This is his second loan with MFP and, despite his being the youngest member of his communal bank, it is he who sees that the rules are obeyed for he is the group's sargeant at arms and the first one to arrive at each meeting. With the funds requested he will buy coffee seeds and chemical fertilizers to set up his nursery.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy coffee seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en: Tomasa C. A. is 44 years old.  She started a business selling used clothing and that developed into a boutique with nicer clothes. She sells good quality clothing, and has built up a loyal customer base. She also distributes her products to other bigger stores. Tomasa needs a loan to buy more merchandise to increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for her boutique.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en:
Julienne is a 43-year-old widow with seven children aged between 10 and 22. She lives in Gasabo, a region of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Julienne has been successful in the business of selling Irish potatoes for the the past five years. She employs one person to work full time in her business. Julienne's working hours are from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily except Sunday.

Julienne needs to increase her capital so that she may expand her business through purchasing more Irish potatoes. To achieve this, she is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company. With this additional business, Julienne is expecting to satisfy her current customers as well as attracting new customers and earning more profit.

This profit will allow Julienne to accumulate savings, which she expects to use in the future for more sources of income.

loans.use: To purchase more Irish potatoes

loans.name: Shade

texts.en:
Shade sells frozen foods and sarongs. She has been in business for twenty years and with this business she supports her husband in providing for the family. She is a very hardworking and focused woman.

With this loan of N100,000, Shade plans to expand her frozen food and sarongs business, which is now booming. With this kind of business she hopes to increase her earnings in the long run and be able to better provide for her children's education.

Shade is 36 years old, is married and has three children. She says thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and frozen food to sell

loans.name: Geny

texts.es:
La señora Geny, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Breo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 40 años y es madre de 03 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Deseando ver profesional a sus hijos y tener sus propios ingresos para poder lograrlo, decidió emprender su propio negocio. Nos cuenta que en su vida paso por altas y bajas, pero su carácter emprendedor que le ha caracterizado siempre y las ganas de salir adelante, le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de comidas prepararas y lleva 4 años ejerciendo este tipo de actividad. Vende sus comidas en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. Poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes que son sus vecinos, amigos y familiares. Por su buena sazón que le pone a sus comidas, sus  ventas le van muy bien.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500.00, comprara insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, pollos y huevos en javas, plátanos en racimos, fideos y aceites en docenas, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  

Geny, como le dicen de cariño, se siente con muchas fuerzas todavía para seguir con sus ventas de comidas. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Sra. Geny is a member of the Commuanl Bank “El Breo”, which is in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 40 years old, single, and the mother of three dependent children.

Hoping to see her children become professionals who can earn their own income, Geny decided to establish her own business. She has experienced several highs and lows in her life, but the enterprising spirit she is always known for has allowed her to succeed. Geny started selling prepared meals and has been in business now for four years. She sells the food out of her home, which is well-equipped for accommodating her customers. Geny gradually developed a good reputation among neighbors, friends, and relatives who became her customers. Sales have done well because her food is very flavorful.

With this loan of 2500 soles, Geny will buy supplies needed for preparing meals such as sacks of rice and sugar, cases of chickens and eggs, bananas by the bunch, noodles and oil by the dozen, as well as cooking utensils. This will enable her to provide quality service. Geny still feels strongly about continuing her business. She thanks Manuela Ramos for contributing toward the completion of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: 01-Dong Son Group

texts.en:
"Nhung D. T. (10) is a 50 year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Nhung leads a five member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group will receive an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the entire loans if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this group is 01-Dong Son (37166).

Nhung is married and has three adult-aged children.  To make a living, Nhung runs a general store, selling a variety of products in the local community.  Nhung has been in this business for over four years and earns approximately 1.500.000 VND a month.

In 2004, Nhung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Nhung successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.079.800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to expand the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND to further expand the business.  The loan will be the eigth from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Nhung plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  N. T. Dan (11), a 53 year-old woman is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business specialized retail store.

2.  N. T. Loan (9), a 61 year-old woman is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.

3.  N. T. Thanh (8), a 49 year-old woman is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.

4.  L. T. T. (12), a 47 year-old is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.
-------------------------------------------------
About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


Nhung D. T. (10) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Nhung là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 01-Dong Son (37166).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại sản phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Nhung thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Nhung kiếm được khoảng 1.500.000 VND.  Vào 2004, Nhung đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Nhung đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 8th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. T. Dan (11) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


2.  N. T. Loan (9) là 61 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


3.  N. T. Thanh (8) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


4.  L. T. T. (12) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  D. việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Kamene

texts.en: Kamene is 41 years old and a single mother of three children who attend school.  She has been selling men’s wear for fifteen years.  As a member of Faulu Kenya, she plans to take out her first loan of Kes. 20,000. She plans to add more stock of trousers.  She hopes to open her own boutique in the future.  She describes herself as hard-working.

loans.use: To add more stock of trousers

loans.name: Señor De Milagros 2 Group

texts.es: El grupo “Señor D. Milagros” esta representado por la señora Macaria y conformado por 11 miembros 5 varones y 6 mujeres los cuales se caracterizan por ser amigos y conocidos desD. hace tiempo ya que todas residen en el mismo barrio. El señor Andrés es un miembro destacado del grupo ya que se dedica a la albañilería y es un hombre muy trabajador durante el día trabaja en obras grandes con contratistas y en las noches trabaja en pequeñas obras en casas privadas con la ayuda D. sus esposa para poder obtener un mayor ingreso y darles a sus tres niños una mejor calidad D. vida, el vive en alquiler hasta que pueda juntar dinero para comprar un lote y poder tener su propia casa pero para ello le hace falta seguir trabajando para cumplir su sueño, Don Andrés destinara su crédito a la compra D. herramientas para colocar cerámica y poder abarcar mas trabajos con un menor tiempo en la obra. El resto D. los miembros del grupo se dedican a diferentes actividades comerciales como la venta D. pollo, venta D. yogurt, venta D. carne y verduras, tienda, carpintería y uno es mecánico. Existe competencia pero los socios son conocidos ya que viven más D. 25 años por la zona y tienen clientes ya establecidos. El destino del financiamiento es para capital D. operaciones e inversión en los negocios D. los clientes ya que a futuro piensan expandirse en el mercado D. donD. están con nosotros. Una gran mayoría cuenta con experiencia en grupos solidarios gracias a financiamientos en entidades similares a la fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
Macaria represents the Señor D. Milagros group. It is comprised of 11 members, 5 men and 6 women. They are friends who have known each other for a long time because they all live in the same neighborhood. Andrés is a member who stands out in the group. He is a bricklayer, and he is a very hard-working man. During the day he works on big jobs with contractors, and in the evenings he works on small jobs in private houses. His wife helps him in order to be able to get greater income and give their children a better quality of life. He lives in a rental until he is able to get together the money to buy a lot and have his own house. To do this he needs to keep working to fulfill his dream. Andrés will use the loan to buy tools to put down tiles and be able to do more jobs in less time. The other members of the group work at different commercial activities like selling chicken, selling yogurt, selling meat and vegetables, a store, carpentry, and one member is a mechanic. Competition exists, but the members are well known because they have lived in the area for over 25 years, and they have established customers. The loan is for operating capital and investment in their businesses. In the future they plan to expand in the market from where they are with us. Most of them have experience with communal banks thanks to loans with entities similar to the Agrocapital Foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Maritza Isabel

texts.es:
