La Señora Maritza Isabel S. es comerciante del sector del barrio  Santa Ana, ella tiene su negocio en el parque central de Chinandega, ahí ella es la encargada de administrar los servicios higiénicos, a la vez elle puso una ventesita de bisutería y de productos de emergencias, toallas sanitarias, pamper, sánicos, toallas de mano etc. El negocio lo inicio con un capital de C$ 1,000 vendiendo solo lo que son caramelos, La Señora S. es un señora que se esfuerza por trabajar y sacar adelante a sus hijos son dos uno de ellos trabaja pero vive en su casa  le ayudan pero ella trabaja para la mantención del hogar.
Tiene 4 años de tener su negocio  y de trabajar con la institución  tiempo para agradecer ya que a través de estos financiamientos su casa ha venido mejorando y su negocio  tambien.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maritza Isabel S. is merchant in the neighborhood of Santa Ana; she has a business in the central park of Chinandega where she is in charge of managing the restroom and personal hygiene services; she also setup a stand where she sells miscellaneous goods and emergency products for personal hygiene such as feminine pads, pampers, paper towels, etc. She started the business with a capital of C$ 1,000 selling candy. Mrs. S. is dedicated to working hard and providing a better life for her children; one son works but lives at home and helps her, but she works to provide for the household. She has 4 years with her business and also working with the organization; she is very grateful since through these loans she has been able to improve her home and business.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy miscellaneous goods, toilet paper, feminine pads, pampers.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.en: Akouvi D. is 32 years-old. She is married and does not have children. She lives and works in the Adidogomé district of Lomé, Togo selling cell phones and mobile phone accessories. She began this business in 2006 and is requesting her third loan from Kiva partner WAGES. She will use this loan to resupply her stock in order to better serve her customers. By working to keep Togo connected, Mrs. D.’s business will continue to grow.

loans.use: To purchase cell phones and accessories for resale.

loans.name: 03 Thieu Toan _ Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Hien N. T. (1) is a 45-year-old femaL. living in the town of Thieu Hoa _ Thanh Hoa.  Hien is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 03 Thieu Toan _ Thieu Hoa (03 Thieu Toan _ Thieu Hoa).


Hien is married and has two school-aged children.  To making a living, Hien operates a family member's business raising cattL. for saL..  Hien has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, Hien joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hien has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,078,900 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 4,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Hien from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Hien plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  H. T. Che (2) is a 48-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  L. T. Binh (3) is a 48-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hien N. T. (1) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở  Thieu Hoa _ Thanh Hoa.  Hien là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 03 Thieu Toan _ Thieu Hoa (03 Thieu Toan _ Thieu Hoa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Hien thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hien kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, Hien đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hien đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.078.900 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 8th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  H. T. Che (2) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  L. T. Binh (3) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Robaba Zaghona Group

texts.en:
Naimaullah, the son of M. A., is 26 years old and the leader of the Robaba Zaghona group. He is an educated man with much experience. He has a stationary shop in the city of Kabul. He needs a small loan to help his business become strong and his family to manage better.

With the loan, he wants to enlarge and expand his business, so he wants to buy pens, pencils, notebooks, sharpeners and more. He also wants to buy the necessary materials to complete his stock for the shop and start working hard.

loans.use: to buy pens, pencils, notebooks and sharpeners for his stationary shop

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Roxana P. es una de  las 10 integrantes de la Alcancía Comunal Nueva Esperanza actualmente  casada y tiene dos hijos de 7 y 5 años es por ellos que la motiva a seguir luchando. Decide emprender hace 5 años  en el negocio de una pequeña librería que acondiciono en su domicilio, empezó con una pequeña vitrina en donde exhibía  los útiles (cuadernos, papel  bond, entre otros). Sus ingresos fueron mejorando  con el tiempo, logrando adquirir  2 stantes grandes, 5 computadoras y  una fotocopiadora con el transcurrir el tiempo, hoy en su librería brinda el servicio de alquiler de cabinas de internet y fotocopias.
Ella notaba que su ingreso iba mejorando  y en un  momento apropiado  por intermedio de una amiga  llego a Edaprospo , Su primer préstamo lo invirtió en  la mercadería de su librería  productos que  se venden  a menudo,  el préstamo actual que  recibió de Edaprospo lo invertirá en la compra de su mercadería tanto en útiles escolares como también 3 cajas grandes  de hojas blancas que utiliza constantemente en su fotocopiadora.
Las metas que se ha propuesto es de ofrecer la venta de libros de distintas editoriales y sobre todo lo esencial de toda persona  el de apoyar a sus menores  hijos en todo.
texts.en:
Roxana P. is one of the 10 members of Alcanía Comunal Nueva Experanza (New Hope Community Bank), is now married, and has two children ages 7 and 5 who motivate her to continue fighting. She decided 5 years ago to start a business: a small book store out of her home, that began as a small shop window in which she exhibited school supplies (note books, bond paper, among others). Her profits improved with time, allowing her to buy 2 big shelves, 5 computers and a photocopier with the passing of time, today in her book store she offers the service of renting internet booths and photocopiers. She noticed that her profits were improving and at the right moment by way of a friend, she came to Edaprospo. She invested her first loan in the merchendise of her book store products that are sold frequently, the loan that she received now from Edaprospo she will invest in the purchase of her merchandise as well as in school supplies such as 3 large boxes of white papers that she constantly uses in her photocopier. The goal that she has proposed is to offer the sale of books from different publishers and above all the essential of every person - the support of her young children in everything.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: EN LA COMPRA DE SU MERCADERIA COMO UTILES ESCOLARES

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita T. is from the village of Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Carmelita is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as noodles, eggs, shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Carmelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Carmelita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is comprised mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
H. Firuza is 32 years old, married, and has 4 children. Her husband is an entrepreneur. For more than 6 years, Firuza has been engaged in the business of selling fabrics for national dresses. She gets up at 6 a.m. to prepare breakfast for her husband and children and afterwards, she is busy selling her merchandise until 5 p.m. With this loan, Firuza plans to buy fabrics to increase the range of her selling goods. She is very happy that, thanks to her effort, she has less worry, can help her children with their homework, and is able to make a contribution to her family. Firuza is very grateful for the support that IMON International, with the help of Kiva, provides for her business.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to increase working capital to develop the business

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es: Elvis, tiene 29 años, vive con su pareja Melida, de 30 años, y con su hijo ángel de 2 años, en su casa propia, ubicado en la localidad de Alto Yapaz. La agricultura, es su actividad principal desde hace 6 años, y lo realiza de manera independiente, sobre terrenos que posee, ahí mismo emplea todas las técnicas agrícolas que le enseñó su padre, cuidando de esta manera sus cultivos de plátano, frutas cítricas, café y piña, permitiéndole a su cónyuge que le ayude aplicando abono y quitarle la maleza en sus campos sembrados. Lo que más le gusta es cosechar y encajonar los frutos para embarcarlos directamente  a los mercados de su ciudad que es de “Huancayo” y la de la capital “Lima”, sin embargo le incomoda pagar un precio exagerado por el traslado de sus cosechas. Pero como su actividad es muy rentable, desea en el futuro comprar más terrenos que le generen mayor productividad, también quiere construir otra casa con mayores comodidades para brindarle calidad de vida a su familia. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y manifiesta que le gusta trabajar en su grupo comunal, porque esta integrado de personas solidarias, responsables y honestas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono y algunas trampas para erradicar la proliferación de insectos en sus chacras.
texts.en:
29-year old Elvis lives with his wife Melida who is 30 years old and their angelic 2-year old son. They live in their own house which is located in Alto Yapaz. Elvis has worked in agriculture for six years. He has his own fields so is not dependent on anyone else. He uses all the farming techniques that his father taught him and grows bananas, citrus fruits, coffee, and pineapples. His wife helps him to apply fertilizer and keep his fields weed-free. Of all the tasks he does, he most enjoys harvesting and packing the fruit ready to be sent directly to the markets in Huancayo, his nearest town, and also to the capital Lima. He dislikes having to pay the high cost of transportation of the produce. But as the work is very profitable he wishes to buy more land in the future so that he can grow more fruit. Elvis also wishes to build another more comfortable house so that he can provide his family a better quality of life. This is his second loan with Kiva partner MFP. He enjoys working with his community group as it is composed of committed, responsible, and honest people. With the loan Elvis will buy several sacks of fertilizer and some traps to eradicate the many insects on his land.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insect traps

loans.name: Osvaldo Javier

texts.es:
El Sr. Osvaldo V. es cliente recurrente, vive en casa propia. El titular es fotógrafo independiente hace mas de 5 años, realiza trabajos para todo tipo de eventos , (cumpleaños, casamientos, colaciones de colegios, etc.). 
Solicito dicho préstamo para la compra de una nueva cámara digital de tal forma a realizar mejor sus trabajos.
 El titular opera con la Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2010  abonando en fecha su préstamo,  que a  la vez  le ha ayudado para su inversión y mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Señor Osvaldo V. is a repeat client who lives in his own house. He is a freelance photographer and has spent the last five years photographing all kinds of events (birthdays, weddings, graduation ceremonies etc.). He is requesting a loan to buy a new digital camera to improve his work. Señor V. has worked with the Fundación Paraguaya since 2010, paying back his loans on time, which has helped him with his investment and improved his standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new digital camera

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la fotografía es la esposa la señora Barbará Blanco.

El señor Eduardo R. esta terminando de un construir un cuarto en su vivienda para ofrecer a su familia mas comodidad. La casa que obtuvieron es de interés social por lo que son muy pequeñas las 2 recamaras, sus hijos ya están creciendo y necesitan su propio espacio. Para poder realizar su proyecto el quiere comprar material de construcción.
texts.en:
The person who appears in the photograph is Sra. Barbará Blanco, the wife of the borrower.

Sr. Eduardo R. is finishing the construction of a room in his home to make his family more comfortable. His house, which he obtained through a government subsidy program, has two very small bedrooms. His children are growing and need their own space. In order to complete this project, he needs to buy construction materials.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to complete the construction of a room

loans.name: Bayardo Jose

texts.es: El señor Bayardo Jose Q. C., tiene la edad de 56 años con su esposa habita en la Comunidad  Sandino, es casado y su esposa labora en las tareas del hogar,  sus hijos habitan en el exterior y bajo remesas apoyan a sus padres en los gastos en que incurren mensualmente, el señor Bayardo se dedica a la agricultura, y tiene más de 20 años de experiencia en esta actividad, uno de los problemas ha sido la afectación de las pagas y es por esta razón que desearían realizar un estudio para la conservación del suelo y mejorar así las cosechas, ellos planean solicitar un préstamo para la compra de insumos fertilizantes vegetativos, y plaguicidas con el fin de brindar un mejor mantenimiento a su terrenos. Espera le apoyen a mejorar sus ventas y a largo plazo mejorar sus condiciones económicas para el bienestar de él y su esposa, sobretodo para la remodelacion de su humilde hogar y morar en un lugar digno y comodo sus dias de avanzada edad.
texts.en:
Señor Bayardo Jose Q. C. is 56 years old and lives in the community of Sandino with his wife who looks after the household. Their children live overseas and send money home to help their parents with their monthly expenses. Bayardo has been a farmer for more than twenty years. One of the problems that he experiences is disease, and for this reason the couple wishes to do some work on soil conservation and improve the harvests. They plan to ask for a loan to buy organic fertilizer and insecticides to improve the quality of their fields. They hope that this will bring about an increase in sales and in the long term an improvement in their financial situation. Most of all, they wish to make improvements to their simple home and live in a decent and comfortable place as they grow older.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his fields

loans.name: Teresa Margarita

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo encontramos la ciudadela San Gregorio lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal San Gregorio.

Aquí conversamos con la señora Margarita, tienen seis hijos fruto de una relación de unión libre que mantiene  hace treinta años, vive en una casa alquilada en la cual habitan siete personas.

Ella se dedica a la  venta de ropa interior, su forma de trabajo es venta de puerta en puerta, trabaja de cuatro a cinco horas al día,  cuatro días de la semana. Nos cuenta que le va muy bien ya que la mercadería que ella vende es de  muy buena calidad y es seleccionada. Viaja a Guayaquil una vez al mes a comprar su mercadería  y  traer   variedad que es lo que le gusta a sus clientes.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar lencería de damas ya que tiene muchos pedidos por entregar. Está en el Banco hace cinco ciclos y le gusta porque le han brindado muchos beneficios.
 
Su sueño son tener su propia casa para bien personal y de su familia.
texts.en:
In the outskirts of Portoviejo, we find the Ciudadela San Gregorio, a place where the members of the communal bank "San Gregorio" meet twice a month. Here we talked to Margarita, who has 7 children resulting from a common-law marriage which has lasted for 30 years. She lives in a rented home with 7 people. She sells underwear door-to-door, working 4 to 5 hours a day, 4 days a week. She tells us that it is going very well, since she sells choice merchandise that is of good quality. She travels to Guayaquil once a month to buy her merchandise and to bring a variety that is appealing to her customers. She will use this loan to buy lingerie for women, since she has a lot of orders to deliver. She has been in the bank for 5 loan cycles, and she likes it because it has provided her with a lot of benefits. Her dream is to have her own home for the benefit of herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy underwear for women

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie P. is 51 years old, married and has five adult-aged children. He is from the village of Barangay Munguia within the municipality of Dupax del Norte, a part of Nueva Vizcaya province on the Luzon islands. Julie is a farmer who grows and harvests rice to sell. He has been in business for over twenty years and earns approximately 45,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2009 Julie joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. Julie successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Julie is requesting a new loan, his fourth from ASKI, of 22,000 PHP that will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Inmaculada Concepción De Maria Group

texts.es:
El comité “Inmaculada Concepción de Maria” tiene  4 meses  de formación y trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya, la mayoría de sus integrantes  ya  realiza actividades productivas, pero para el nuevo ciclo incluyeron entre sus integrantes  a  señoras que emprenderán actividades. 
Todas realizan actividades variadas a la conveniencia de cada una así como la Sra. Antolina quien decidió  dedicarse a la venta de ropas desde su casa ya que está en una zona muy concurrida.
Ella comenta que se encuentra muy contenta con el grupo y que le gustaría aumentaría aumentar la cantidad y variedad de mercaderías con que cuenta en su negocio.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de pantalones, calzados, shorts, camisas, remeras, vestidos.
texts.en: The “Inmaculada Concepción de Maria” committee formed 4 months ago and works with Fundación Paraguaya.  Most of the members already engage in productive activities, but for their new cycle they have included in their membership women who will undertake new enterprises.  Each has a different activity according to her particular convenience, such as Sra. Antolina who decided to begin selling clothing from her home since she lives in a very crowded area.  She says that she is very happy with the group and that she would like to increase the quantity and variety of clothing offered by her business.  She is requesting this loan to purchase pants, socks, shorts, shirts, T-shirts and dresses.

loans.use: Purchase of stock such as  T-shirts, shirts, dresses and socks

loans.name: Aloys

texts.en:
Aloys N. is forty years old. He is married with five children who are now between the ages of one and fourteen. Four of his children are currently attending school. Aloys is from Kisii in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for ten years and employs one farmhand. His farm produces napier grass (used as animal forage and for biofuels) and bananas that are all sold locally. He also owns and manages a local school.

Aloys has requested this loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him pay school fees for his children with no problems. His biggest challenge in farming has been insufficient land upon which to expand his farming activities. He hopes, however, to expand his dairy farming in the future by acquiring more dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther K. is currently in the business of selling onions, rice, and cooking oil, and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of rice and onions to sell.  Esther is 38 years old and is married. Her husband is a government worker. She has six children and all of them attend school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more bags of rice and onions to sell

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is from the village of Naga in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Cynthia, who is married and has two school-aged children, owns and operates a general store. Cynthia has been engaged in her business for over two years, earning approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Cynthia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 14900 PHP from PMPC, Emma is now requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP for the additional capital for her retail store. This will be her fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 


About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her retail store

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert U. is from the town of Trinidad. He is 30 years old and single. To make a living, Gilbert owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish to the market. Gilbert says he is saving for his future as he also wants to have his own family.

Gilbert joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gilbert has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Gilbert is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena K. is married and has three children. Her husband is a teacher. Abena sells porridge made from millet. She often serves her porridge with bread, milk and sugar at Abura. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She is asking for the loan to purchase more ingredients to prepare porridge for sale.  She plans to reinvest her profit back into her business.

At the time this picture was taken, Abena had finished selling the bread and is demonstrating how she pours the millet porridge into polythene bags for her customers.

loans.use: purchase more ingredients to prepare porridge for sale

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: La Sra. Ángela vende condimentos; ajinomoto (condimento para dar sabor a las comidas), aji en vaina ( para moler en batan y dar color y picante en los jigotes), también tuntas (papa deshidratada), chuños (papa deshidratada que acompaña a diferentes platos típicos de La Paz), ajo; trae también duraznos secos que se utiliza para hacer frescos de kisa y frazadas de plaza y media  como de dos plazas,  ella viaja todos los viernes por sus productos al Desaguadero frontera con el Perú es una feria concurrida por muchos comerciantes tanto como del Perú y Bolivia. Los productos que ella trae  los vende por mayor y al detalle en El Alto como en los diferentes mercados de La Paz.   Vive en Alto Miraflores Barrio Ferroviario  su casa es propia. La Sra. Ángela no tiene hijos vive con su esposo es una persona muy responsable con muchos deseos de superación, trabajadora, se lleva bien con sus vecinos, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de material de construcción para la culminación de la obra fina de su cocina, esta agradecida con la institución por el poyo brindado.
texts.en: Mrs. Ángela sells seasoning. For example, she offers MSG (to flavor foods) and chiles (to grind and give color and spice to minced meat), as well as freeze-dried potatoes, dried potatoes, which accompany different traditional dishes in La Paz, and garlic. She also brings dried peaches that she uses to make soft drinks and blankets to central squares to sell. She travels every Friday to sell her products at a fair in Desaguadero, which is a town on the border with Perú. Many vendors come to this fair from both Perú and Bolivia. She sells her products wholesale, and as retail merchandise in El Alto and in different markets in La Paz. She lives in Alto Miraflores Barrio Ferroviario (her neighborhood) in her own home. Mrs. Ángela does not have any children, and she lives with her husband, who is very responsible.  Her goals include improving her life, working hard, and getting along with her neighbors. The money from this loan will be used to buy construction materials to complete the finishing work on her kitchen. She is thankful for the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: To complete construction on the finishing work for her kitchen

loans.name: Madou

texts.fr:
Monsieur  MADOU S. est un homme  qui est âgé de  40 ans et qui vit avec ses 3 enfants et son épouse dans une famille monogame à N’tentou, dans la ville de Ouelessebougou, préfecture de Kati,  Région de Koulikoro.
Afin de s’insérer dans la vie économique, MADOU S., qui n’a pas eu la chance  de réussir à l’école, s’est vite initié aux activités de stockage commercialement des céréales et des produits de cueillettes tels le néré, les noix d’acajou et  le tamarin.  
Nanti  7 années d’expériences dans le domaine, il est très sollicité.
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, MADOU décide d’adhérer au programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son  septième prêt individuel.
MADOU  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 tonnes de maïs, 1 tonne  d’arachide et 5 sacs de tamarin, auprès des paysans producteurs de Tièlé et de Ouelessebougou qu’il stockera pendant au moins 2 mois. Il effectue sa vente  au marché de Ouelesseboubou, au comptant et rarement à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
MADOU S. espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 100.000 FCFA qui   sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt,  subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mr. Madou S. is a 40-year-old man who lives with his wife and their three children in a monogamous family in N'Tentou, in the town of Ouelessebougou, prefecture of Kati, Koulikoro region. 

Madou S. did not have the opportunity to pursue extensive studies. In order to enter the work force, he soon learned the business of commercial storage of grain and gathered fruits such as nere seeds, cashew nuts and tamarind. With seven years of experience in this activity, he is in high demand.

In his search for complementary financing, Madou turned to the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and is now on his seventh individual loan. 

Madou plans to use his loan to buy two tons of corn, one ton of peanuts and five sacks of tamarind from local producers in Tièlé and Ouelessebougou. The merchandise will be stored for at least two months. He conducts his sales at the Ouelesseboubou market for cash, rarely on credit, to a customer base consisting of both men and women. 

Madou S. hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA which will be used to repay the loan and cover family expenses, the remainder to be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: To purchase grain

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
Abel trabaja como chofer en el sindicato Pedro Domingo Murillo trufi 83 y su parada se encuentra en Ciudad Satélite de la Ciudad de El Alto. Trabaja hace diez años en el sindicato.  El señor Abel es casado y tiene un hijo, la esposa se dedica al comercio así apoyando en los gastos de la casa. Vive en casa de sus padres ya hace mucho tiempo, la casa esta ubicada en la zona de Villa Victoria de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo utilizara para la refacción de su movilidad y compra de línea de trabajo en el trufi 83. Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Abel works as a driver.  He is a member of the Pedro Domingo Murillo Trufi 83 drivers' union and his stop is located in Ciudad Satélite, in the city of El Alto.  He has been working as a member of this union for ten years.  Mr. Abel is married and has one child.  His wife is a saleswoman and helps support him with their household expenses.  Abel has lived in his parents' home for a long time.  The house is located in Villa Victoria neighborhood, in the city of La Paz.

Abel will use his loan to refurbish his vehicle and to buy a permit which allows him to run his taxi on a particular route in the city.  This is how he makes income for his household.

This is Abel's first loan and the socio-economic analysis we have performed qualifies him favorably to obtain a loan.

loans.use: To maintain his taxi and to buy a permit which will allow him to run his taxi on a particular route in the city

loans.name: Punjik

texts.en:
Punjik G. lives in Tolors village of Sisian region, famous for its severely harsh climate conditions. In the winter it is extremely cold, and in the summer it is very hot. The land in Sisian is suitable for growing only a few agricultural products.

Punjik lives with her daughter and son. She works in the local school as a cleaning lady, receiving an extremely low salary,  impossible for the family to survive on. Being a good lender in the past, Punjik has again applied to SEF International for a loan, planning to plant wheat seed, which will bring her additional income.

loans.use: buying wheat seed

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Emprendedoras nació hace más de 3 años mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Este comité es de San Lorenzo, en estos más de cinco años de intenso trabajo han crecido tanto social como económicamente, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
La sra. Cristina por ejemplo, vende frutas en un puesto que posee como propio, pero debido al cambio de estación de clima (verano a otoño) desea poder ampliar la gama de frutas que ofrece a sus clientes, pero para ello necesita de un crédito que la ayude a poder adquirir gran cantidad de frutas, de modo que pueda obtener mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
The committee of Mujeres Emprendedoras (Entrepreneurial Women) formed more than three years ago through the leadership and support of another committee that was working in the area.
This committee is from San Lorenzo and in over the past more than five years of intense work they have grown socially as well as economically and are recognized in that area as very hard-working women.
Cristina, for example, sells fruits in a stand that she owns, but due to the seasonal change in the climate (summer to fall) she would like to be able to expand the range of fruits that she offers to her customers, but she needs a loan to help her to be able to acquire a large quantity of fruits so that she can improve her income.

loans.use: to buy citrus fruits, pomelos, oranges, bananas, passion fruit, etc.

loans.name: La Nueva Union 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the group coordinator of her group, La Nueva Union 1 & 2 (the New Union), and her story is representative of both the members of her group and also of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated from the DR to Haiti. Her group is based in the area surrounding La Romana,  where the economy is based on the sugar cane industry and where there is little access to running water (none of which is potable) or stable electricity. Maria makes her home with her two children and long-term partner.

Maria has proven herself to be an excellent client of Esperanza and she has successfully repaid four loans. With this new loan, she will purchase flour, meat, oil, and other goods to produce empanadas, a meal of flour filled with meat or vegetables. She has identified a market for these goods among her neighbors and she believes the increased profits will allow her to invest more in her business and save some of the capital. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase flour, oil, meat, and vegetables

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa forma parte del banco comunal “Fénix”, perteneciente a la ciudad de La Cisterna.
Ella se dedica a vender y atender en su almacén, que tiene ubicado en el ante jardín de su casa. Elsa trabaja en éste rubro desde hace 12 años. Desde los cuales su negocio le ha brindado ganancias y su clientela también ha aumentado con el pasar de los años. Su horario laboral es de lunes a domingo, durante todo el día. 
Con éste préstamo comprará mercadería para abastecer su almacén. Sus metas son organizar y ampliar su negocio, ya que el espacio que tiene su almacén en la actualidad es muy pequeño y su negocio aumenta de manera considerable. Pretende ampliar su casa y realizar un segundo piso, lo que le brindaría el espacio suficiente para agrandar su negocio. Su sueño a nivel personal es tomarse unas vacaciones, para descansar de su horario laboral. Sus motivaciones para seguir en el negocio son concretar sus proyectos.
Elsa está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito otorgado por Fondo esperanza, ya que éste le permitirá invertir en su negocio y generar mejores ganancias. Respecto a las reuniones estas son muy amenas y se ha generado una buena relación entre los socios del grupo. En cuanto a las capacitaciones que imparte Fondo esperanza, Elsa ha aprendido a distribuir y registrar los gastos y ganancias, generados con el negocio. 
La Cisterna es una comuna ubicada en el sector centro-sur de la región Metropolitana. Es una comuna esencialmente residencial y comercial. En sus inicios era un sector rural, de grandes parcelas, sin embargo debido al crecimiento de su población y la llegada de servicios pasó a ser un sector 100% urbano.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the communal bank “Fenix” that belongs to the city of La Cisterna.  She sells from and manages her store which is located in front of her house.  For the last 12 years she has been in this business from which she has earned a living, and the number of customers has increased as well.  Elsa works all day every day. 
She will use this loan to buy merchandise to stock her store.  Her goals are to organize and enlarge her business since the space that she has is very small and her work has increased considerably.  She would like to enlarge her house and build a second floor so that she will have enough space to expand her business.  Her personal dream is to take some vacations, and to rest from her daily work.
Her motivation is to continue with the business and to carry out her projects.
Elsa is very happy and thankful for the financing from Fondo Esperanza since it allows her to invest in her business and generate better earnings.  The meetings are very pleasant and she has built up a good relationship among the members of the group.  With the training that Fondo Esperanza gives, Elsa has learned how to defer and record the expenses and earnings that she gets from the business.  La Cisterna is a community located in the south central area of Metropolitana.  It’s basically residential and commercial.  At the beginning it was a rural area with big parcels of land but because of the population growth and the arrival of services, it is now a 100% urban.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Kodé

texts.fr: Monsieur Kodé M. vit dans la localité de Dalifort. Il pratique la vente de pièces détachées et de ferrailles. Il exerce cette activité de commerce dans le but de gagner sa vie pour ainsi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il est sociétaire du guichet de Dalifort  depuis mai 2002 ou il a déjà bénéficié de 4 prêts  antérieurs. Il sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de pièces détachées destinées a la vente .Ce financement lui permettra d’élargir son activité de commerce, d’améliorer le niveau de ses revenus et mieux veiller a l’entretien de sa famille.
texts.en: Mr. Kodé M. lives in the town of Dalifort. He works involves selling spare parts and scrap metal. He is in this business to earn his living and thus to support his family. Kodé has been an associate of the Dalifort branch since May 2002 where he has already had four previous loans. He is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs for buying spare parts to resell. This financing will enable him to expand his business, to improve his revenues, and to care for his family better.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Gbetodjin Enonmon Group

texts.fr: GBETODJIN ENONMON est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la présidente (dont le doigt est levé sur la photo) est nommée Adjoavi. Les membres du groupe sont des amies et vivent ensemble dans la même zone à Sainte Rita à Cotonou (capitale économique du Bénin). Née le 27 Février en 1947 à Cotonou, Adjoavi habite le quartier Sainte Rita depuis deux ans. C’est une veuve ayant quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont encore à sa charge. Adjoavi  vit donc seule avec ses enfants et supporte seule leurs différentes charges.  Il y a quatre ans environs que Adjoavi fait le commerce de maïs et du riz à son domicile. Parallèlement, Adjoavi vend de la farine de manioc et des conserves. Cette activité lui procure des revenus l’aidant à assurer les différents besoins de ses enfants. Adjoavi se ravitaille à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et à Savalou dans le centre du Bénin. C'est la deuxième fois que Adjoavi sollicite un financement auprès de ALIDé, afin d'agrandir son activité et d'accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu.
texts.en:
GBETODJIN ENONMON is a group composed of three persons, including the president (with her finger raised in the photo) by the name of Adjoavi. The group members are friends, and they live together in the same area in Sainte Rita, in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Born on February 27, 1947 in Cotonou, Adjoavi has lived in the Sainte Rita district for two years. She is a widow with four children, who have all had schooling. Two of the children are still in her care. She therefore lives alone with her children and covers their various expenses by herself. 

For about four years, Adjoavi has been doing commerce in corn and rice at her house. Concurrently, she sells cassava flour and some canned foods. This business brings in the revenues that help her to meet the different needs of her children. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and in the town of Savalou, in central Benin. This is the second time that she has requested financing from ALIDé in order to expand her business and increase her turnover, as well as her revenues.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, cassava flour, and some canned foods

loans.name: Unity Ii Group

texts.en:
Issa is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs.  He was born in Port Loko, a town in northern Sierra Leone, about 46 years ago. He is married to a trader and the couple has 4 children – 2 in primary school, 1 in secondary school, and the other is no longer attending school. 

This is the first loan that Issa and his group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

For 15 years now, Issa has been selling nails, cements, iron rods, paints, etc.  He will use his share of the loan (SLL 1,000,000) to expand his business.  He will buy nails, cements, iron rods, paints, etc. at wholesale to add to his current inventory.

loans.use: buy construction supplies to resell

loans.name: Mamy Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité est créé le 18 décembre 2001. Il est composé de 13 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale et le petit commerce.

Madame Mousba qui est à gauche de la photo emmitouflée d'une écharpe est le responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 65 ans. Elle est mariée sans enfants mais à la charge de cinq enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches.

Elle fait un petit commerce de sucre et de thé. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l'avoir pratiquer depuis plus de cinq ans.

Ce prêt lui permettra de mieux développer ses activités et de satisfaire sa clientèle.

Les profits générés par son activité lui permettront d'aider son mari dans la prise en charge des frais de nourriture de la famille.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on December 18, 2001. It is composed of 13 women who live in the same neighborhood. Their main business is selling various small items. 

Madame Mousba who is on the left of the photo wrapped in a scarf is the leader of the group. She is 65 and married with no biological children but responsible for five children who have been confided to her by those around her. 

She sells sugar and tea. She has a good deal of experience in this field since she has been working at it for more than five years.

This loan will permit her to develop her business and satisfy her clientele. The profit from her business will allow her to help her husband take charge of food expenses for the family.

loans.use: to buy sugar and tea.

loans.name: Risper

texts.en:
Risper is a widow with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past three years, she has operated a taxi business; her potential customers are travelers and neighbours. 

In addition she also operates a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Risper faces a major challenge of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing more business in the future. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 46 years old and is married with three children aged between 3 and 12 years of age. Her business is well-organized. She sells various goods such as soap, peanuts, beans, etc.  Jacqueline has six years' experience and she currently employs four people to help her. She is working from 7 a.m. until 9 p.m. every day.

Jacqueline has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to increase her stock by purchasing various goods such as soap, peanuts, beans, rice, salt, drinks, etc. to sell.  With these profits, Jacqueline will reinvest in her business and save for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase goods such as soap, peanuts, beans, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Uganda. She is married and has four children, two of whom are in school. Joyce lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication, feeding the family and school fees.  

She has a beauty salon business. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Joyce has requested for a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids. The main business challenges for Joyce include seasonality and transportation.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are own a bridal salon and also to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata is 70 years old and married with four children. Three of her children live outsiD. the house and one child still lives with her while she finishes her studies at the Ninda University in Cusco. 

Fortunata is the owner of a small grocery store that sells different kinds of soft drinks, beer, snacks, and household needs. She has had her grocery store for over 30 years. In addition, Fortunata has a small business planning weddings, baptisms, and birthday parties on the weekends. She is asking for a loan to buy materials for the events that she plans because she does not get paid until after she gives the event. She is a very hard-working woman and is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy materials for events she plans such as weddings, baptisms, and birthdays.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his coffee mill.

loans.name: Zoila Azucena

texts.es: Zoila de 29 años de edad es soltera trabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace 7 años como responsable de servicios generales. Esta solicitando  su 5to credito para la construccion de un cuarto en su casa, pues desea acondicionar un poco la casa ya que es pequeña y como vive con sus hermanas desea acondicionar su propio espacio para tener mayor privacidad.  Espera poder seguir siendo beneficiada con el fondo kiva, pues anteriormente logro la construccion de la cocina gracias al financiamiento que obtuvo en AFODENIC y Kiva.
texts.en: Zoila  is 29-years-old and single.  She has worked at the mayor's office in Juigalpa for 7 years and is responsible for general services.  She is requesting her 5th loan to construct a room in her home.  She hopes to fix up her house a little bit since it is small and she lives with her sisters.  She hopes to fix up her own space so she can have more privacy.  She hopes to keep being benefitted with funds from Kiva.  She was previously able to construct her kitchen thanks to the financing she received from Afodenic and Kiva.

loans.use: to construct a room

loans.name: Modoukpe

texts.fr:
Modoukpe est une femme âgé(e) de 27 ans. Elle est mariée å un soudeur. Elle a 01 enfant. 
Modoukpe travaille comme revendeuse de produits cosmétiques depuis 2006. Elle sert ses clients dans un marché de la place après avoir acheté au grand Marché de Lomé.
Modoukpe a requis son  premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
Modoukpe is a 27-year-old woman married to a welder. She has one child. 

Modoukpe has been a small-scale retailer selling cosmetics since 2006. She serves her customers in a local marketplace after having bought her merchandise at the Grand Market in Lomé.

Modoukpe has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Namukhe Shg Group

texts.en:
Alice is the facilitator of the Namukhe SHG group. Alice and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Alice takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to be able to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and was particularly pleased with the terms of the loan repayment, which begins early and is gradual. In the recent 2011 season, Alice had an excellent maize yield harvesting 8 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Alice was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 2 acres of land.

With income from the maize sales, Alice will educate her children and invest in livestock, which will help her repay her loan.

In 2012, the members of Namukhe SHG group will each plant maize on plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Boris Gerson

texts.es:
Boris, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 8 y 11 años, el comenzó su taller de escapes y radiadores (reparación de vehículos) hace  diez años lo aprendió de ayudante ahora tiene su propio taller, trabaja todos los días de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar herramientas como: llaves, escapes usados y nuevos, radiadores, de esa forma podra brindar un mejor servicio, tendrá más  clientes y obtendrá ingresos para beneficio de su familia.
El sueño de Boris mejorar cada día sus ingresos tener todas las herramientas necesarias y sobre todo darles una mejor vida a sus familia.
texts.en:
Boris lives with his wife and two children who are 8 and 11 years old. He started his exhaust pipe and radiator (vehicle repair) shop ten years ago.   He learned as a shop assistant and now has his own shop. He works every day Monday through Sunday.

He needs the loan to buy tools like: wrenches, used and new exhaust pipes and radiators to provide better service, have more customers and obtain income to benefit his family.

Boris’ dream is to improve his income every day and to have all the necessary tools but, above all, to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy wrenches, exhaust pipes and radiators.

loans.name: Duo Solidario San Fransisco Group

texts.es: Duo Solidario San Fransisco. Este Duo esta integrado por dos señoras ellas se dedican a la venta D. cosmeticos,doña Silvia una D. las que integra este duo siendo ella la lider D. este duo,ella se dedica a esta actividad desD. hace 4 años,nos cuenta que su venta es muy bendible en su comunidad,es por eso que esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. cosmeticos para surtir mejor su ventas y D. la misma manera la siguiente socia,ellas le dan gracias a Dios por que le den ese apoyo que ellas nececitan para sacar adelante a sus familia, y seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en: The group Duo Solidario San Francisco is maD. up of two women who sell cosmetics. Silvia is the leader of this duo. She has been doing this for 4 years and tells us that her business is highly marketable in her community. For this reason she is asking for a loan to buy cosmetics to better supply her sales. Her business partner will do the same. They give thanks to God for giving them this support that they need to get their families ahead and move forward with their business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is married and blessed with four children, all of whom attend school. She has been running a grocery business for the last seventeen years to make a living. Her customers are passersby and people living in that area. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. Since Lucy joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale

loans.name: Anas

texts.en: Anas is a 21-year-old young man. He is a worker with a decent salary. He is a university student majoring in Business Administration and wants to complete paying his fees, but he does not have enough money. Therefore, he needs to take a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Anas gets the loan, he will be able to pay his university fees and complete his course to graduate and get a university degree in Business. This will improve his standard of living and enable him to get better work in the future. Anas is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To pay university fees.

loans.name: Tonggara Grace Group

texts.en: Katarina is 35 years old and married with one child. She is pictured standing in the middle of the photo wearing a red shirt. She has been selling drinks and phone minute refills for two years in front of her house. The sales are going well and she enjoys running the kiosk because it has taught her a lot about business. She is still trying learn the best way to grow her business and increase her income. She is thinking about moving to a better location in the future. Her husband is an electrician, and together they have enough income to support the daily needs of the family and the preschool fees for their child. This is her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia and she plans to use it to buy more drinks and mobile phone minute refills to sell and hopefully help grow her business.

loans.use: to pay for more drinks and mobile phone minute refills to sell in her kiosk.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a single woman aged 30. She has been selling clothes to earn a living. Her business is very competitive due to the quality of her products. She has a reliable customer base. Her potential customers are the local residents. She is requesting for a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy shirts and blouses for resale. In the next five years, she plans to establish a wholesale business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy shirts and blouses for resale.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 35-year-old Lebanese man living with his wife and child. He’s their only support and they trust he can provide for all of their needs. He started to work as a farmer in 2008, after being involved in the agricultural field for five years. He loves his work and is willing to make sacrifices in order to get a good harvest. Today, he’s looking to borrow $1,600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy seeds and fertilizers for his land. This Kiva loan will certainly boost his productivity, thus boosting his earnings. In the future, he plans to buy new land and increase his productivity in fruit and vegetable farming.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for his land.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando, de 49 años, es un hombre trabajador, honesto y muy responsable, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene tres hijos de 20, 12 y 3 años, ellos son su razón de mucho trabajo y sacrificio. Vive en su casa propia en donde comparte la alegría de criar a sus hijos a lado de su pareja a quien le brinda las comodidades que puede. El trabajo de Rolando, consiste en la venta de abarrotes al por menor, se encarga de comprar en cantidades y los vende al menudeo, tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa en una calle muy concurrida y con mucho potenciales clientes. Además de trabajar en su bodega, también se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas y alcohólicas a personas mayores de edad, lleva realizando este trabajo por ya 8 años y lo hace con la ayuda de su conviviente. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite generar ingresos desde la comodidad de su hogar, además de poder trabajar a lado de sus conviviente. Espera poder seguir consolidándose con su trabajo y aumentar con sus productos ya que le falta algunas cosas necesarias para su venta. Le gustaría más adelante poner un minimarket y así ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes. Este será el tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que esta muy emocionado que una entidad le este dando la confianza de poder invertir mas su capital de trabajo y así poder crecer económicamente, agradece mucho por lo que le brindaran y promete no defraudar y ser responsable y puntual en sus cuotas, esta contento trabajar con su banco comunal ya que son muy exigentes con su puntualidad. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará productos para su bodega, bebidas, lácteos, arroz, azúcar y otros mas para así ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rolando, 49, is a very hard-working, honest and responsible man.  He lives with his common-law wife and three children, ages 20, 12 and 3, who are the reason for so much work and sacrifice.  He lives in his own house where he shares with his wife the joys of raising children and trying to give them as many comforts as possible.  Rolando has a small retail grocery business in his house which is on a busy street with many potential customers.  He also works selling sodas and alcoholic beverages to adults, which he has done for eight years with his wife's help.

What he enjoys about his work is that he can generate an income from the comfort of his own home while also working alongside his wife.  He hopes to consolidate his business and add the products he needs to have on hand.  In the future he would like to establish a minimarket and offer a wider variety of items to customers.

This is his third loan through MFP and he is very excited about the fact that an organization is placing confidence in him so he can increase his working capital and grow economically.  He is very grateful for the support and promises not to disappoint anyone and is committed to paying back the loan on time.  He is happy working with his communal bank because they are very adamant about punctuality.  He plans to use the 1,000 PEN loan to buy products for his store such as beverages, dairy products, rice, sugar and other items to offer more variety to his customers.

loans.use: To buy beverages, dairy products, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Niño Jesús Group

texts.es:
Niño Jesús es el grupo conformado por 13 mujeres de la ciudad de Curuguaty. Ellas se encuentran en el primer ciclo, ellas dicen que está aprendiendo a trabajar en equipo y a tener mejores ingresos para sus familias. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y honestas que día a día luchan por tener un mejor estilo de vida.
Una de las miembros es la señora Maria, quien se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de prendas usadas. Comenta que le va muy bien, ya que debido a la crisis económica la gente prefiere las prendas de segunda mano por ser más baratas. ella desea poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
María solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de segunda mano para que de esa forma pueda surtirse y tener más variedades para sus clientes.
texts.en:
The "Niño Jesús" (Baby Jesus) Communal Bank is a group of 13 women from the city of Curuguaty. They are embarking on their first loan cycle, and say it means they are learning to work as a team and it is helping them to increase their families' incomes. They are very hardworking, honest women, who strive each day towards a better standard of living.

One of the members is Señora Maria, who sells all kinds of used clothes. It is going well, because, since the economic crisis, people prefer to buy cheaper, second hand clothes. She wants to be able to keep growing her business and so to keep helping her family. María is seeking the loan to buy second hand clothing to stock her business and offer greater variety to her customers.

loans.use: To buy garments to sell on.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is married and has a trisikad (three-wheeled cycle with side cart) transportation business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years. She works hard to support her family. 
Jesusa has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her trisikad.
In the future, Jesusa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her trisikad.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
La socia Felicia; pertenece al banco comunal "SEÑOR DE LA AGONIA DE TARAY"; El banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Taray perteneciente a la Provincia de Pisac departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 41 años de edad y es casada, la socia tiene 2 hijos la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de artesania, la soica tiene un stand que lo comparte con las otras socias de su grupo asociado y ella tiene el stand a su cargo 3 veces por semana y los otros 3 dias lo alberga la otra socia que es su par de asociación, la socia exhibe sus trabjaos realizados por ella como artesanias y otro grupo compra la socia ya hecho. 

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Felicia belongs to the "SEÑOR DE LA AGONIA DE TARAY" communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Taray in the province of Pisac, department of Cuzco. 

She is 41 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. Her job is buying and selling artisanal crafts. She has a stand that she shares with other members of the group. She has the stand 3 times a week and the other 3 days it is used by the other member who is her association partner. She exhibits the artisanal crafts she does herself and another group buys them from her.   

Felicia is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to invest in buying artisanal crafts and materials such as natural oxides and clay.

loans.name: Johana Maria

texts.es:
Johana es una joven de 22 años de edad que se encuentra casada y tiene una hija de 3 meses de nacido, y hace aproximadamente 1 año viene ofreciendo el servicio a domicilio de arreglo de uñas. Gracias a este trabajo, ha venido generando ingresos con los que puede contribuir económicamente en su hogar y también sostener algunos gastos que se generan en su hogar. Ahora, Johana quiere montar un salón de belleza en su casa aprovechando la experiencia que tiene y también comenzar con la actividad del corte y cepillado del cabello, en el cual lleva algún tiempo estudiando. Debido a que no cuenta con el capital suficiente, Johana busca un préstamo para comprar un tocador, una silla, un espejo y un lavacabezas para iniciar su negocio.

De esta manera podrá iniciar su propio negocio y así generar más ingresos para su hogar. Johana ve una gran oportunidad el tener el negocio en su propia casa ya que podrá cuidar de mejor manera a su hija de 3 meses, y así brindarle una buena calidad de vida. Su sueño es tener un buen negocio con el que pueda tener una estabilidad económica en su hogar y con el cual pueda brindar una buena calidad de vida a su hija.

loans.use: Comprar un tocador, una silla, un espejo y un lavacabezas para iniciar su negocio.

loans.name: Muhammad's Group

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 50-year-old man, strong, hard-working, humble and helpful. He has been working his farm for a large part of his life and all of his knowledge he learned thanks to his family who does similar work. He is group leader and standing in the middle by raising his hand in this photo. He is resident of “Lung” a village in District Gujranwala, Pakistan.

He is a poor farmer having 6 defendants, he wants to educate his children with good rural customs, but has meager resources. He works day and night to feed his whole family.
 
He asks for a loan to purchase quality rice seeds and pay for irrigation, seeking to improve and expand his crop production, He dreams to educate his children in good schools and better feed them.

He promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs i.e. fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel etc.

loans.name: Carmen Patricia

texts.es:
Carmen, es una mujer de 47 años de edad que desde hace algún tiempo se ha dedicado a diversas actividades laborales pero siempre con un deseo en su mente que era el incursionar en el área comercial, fue así como desde inicios del año 2012, monto su negocio ofreciendo productos para el cuidado personal.

Carmen se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, amable, con visión y muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por esta razón que se anima a solicitar un crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía como desodorantes, cremas, lociones, tónicos, entre otros, con el fin de darle una mejor imagen al negocio, que logre atraer más clientes y así ofrecerles una variedad de productos que satisfagan las necesidades y gustos de todos los que visiten el negocio. 

De esta manera logrará obtener ingresos para continuar aportando a la economía de su hogar y ahorrar para montar varias sucursales de su negocio y así tendrá un futuro más próspero, donde podrá mejorar notoriamente su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

loans.use: compra de mercancía como desodorantes, cremas, lociones, tónicos, entre otros, con el fin de darle una mejor imagen al negocio

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock in grocery business.

loans.name: Mahammedali

texts.en: Mahammadali is an IDP from Jabrail district of Azerbaijan since 1993. In 2001 he started his private business in Baku city.  In 2004-2006 he borrowed three loans from Normicro, Baku branch which totalled $2400. Now he wants to borrow $1100 to increase the variety of goods in his store.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Kimi

texts.en: Kimi M.’s business is selling ice pops, and her customers are the schoolchildren and the village people. Kimi’s income comes from selling these ice pops, and she also sells chips on the side when she is able. She charges fifty cents for an ice pop and one dollar for the chips. Kimi also brings her ice pops to the center meeting and sells them to the women at the time of the meeting. The freezer is too small for both the ice pops and other things, so she would like to purchase a bigger one. Kimi also wants to run a BBQ in front of her house beside the road together with her ice pops.

loans.use: freezer

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok C., 41 years old, is a mother of 2 children who are students, and she lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To supplement the household income, Sok runs a store selling a variety of soft drinks, and pork/beef rice and noodle soup to the people in her area. From this business activity, she can typically earn around $6.00 each day, while her husband also helps the family's finances by driving a motor-taxi. With the progress of her business and the idea of getting ahead, C. is currently requesting a loan of $500 to expand her business by purchasing more utensils and equipment to operate her store . In the future, she dreams of saving enough money to keep expanding her business and send her children to university.

loans.use: To purchase more utensils and equipment to operate her store.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria, 59, is a single mother of 7 children who are, respectively, 37, 32, 31, 25, 23, 20 and 18 years old. All of her children make a living selling lottery tickets, work that she too has done for around 10 years. As a single mother, with many responsibilities, she had to face the difficult task of raising her children alone and necessity required that she go out and work. She never had a chance to finish school because she came from a poor family and from a very young age, she had to work to help her parents. She now works selling lottery tickets on the buses that go up and down the streets of the capital.

A neighbor introduced her to the Fundacion Paraguaya’s “Comite de Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Committee of Women Entrepeneurs) and she began to join the meetings of the Comite in her neighborhood. Thanks to the help that she gets from Fundacion loans, she can buy more lottery tickets for sale. She needs the loan to buy larger consignments of tickets so that she can get better margins and increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

María tiene 59 años, es madre soltera de 7 hijos de 37, 32,31,25,23,20 y 18 años respectivamente. Todos sus hijos trabajan en la venta de cartones de juego de azar, actividad a la que ella también se dedica hace como 10 años. Desde muy joven se vió en la necesidad de tener que salir a la calle a trabajar ya que es madre soltera y con muchas responsabilidades debido a que debió afrontar sola la difícil tarea de criar a sus hijos. Proviene de una familia muy humilde, por tal motivo no pudo acceder a una educación escolar ya que desde muy joven se vió obligada a trabajar para ayudar a sus padres. Hoy día se dedica a la venta de cartones de juegos de azar en los colectivos que recorren las calles de la ciudad capital.

Por intermedio de una vecina se enteró del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya y comenzó a participar de las reuniones de un Comité de su barrio. Gracias a la ayuda que ella obtiene de los créditos emitidos por la Fundación puede comprar más cartones para vender. Necesita el crédito para comprar más cartones ya que cuando retira a consignación el margen de ganancias es inferior, en cambio cuando tiene la posibilidad de comprarlos obtiene mayores ganancias.

loans.use: Buy lottery tickets for re-sale.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
Description of Business

Domingo has a government warehouse in the commercial area called flor de Bastion. He began his business 4 years ago when he changed work. His wife also has a small store in their house.

Use of loan

He needs the loan to be able to make repairs in his house and buy more merchandise

Personal Information

Domingo is 42 years old and has 2 children who attend school. They live in a house made of cement, and his goal is to be able to finish with the construction of his home.

Descripción del Negocio

el Sr. Domingo tiene una tercena en un sector comercial de la flor de Bastion, empezo hace 4 años cuando cambio de trabajo su esposa ademas siene una pequeña tienda en sus domicilio.

Uso del Préstamo

El necesita el credito para hacer adecuaciones en su casa y comprar mas mercaderia.

Información Personal

El tiene 42 años 2 hijos que estudian su casa es de cemento su meta es terminar de construir su casa.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy different types of meat for his business.

loans.name: Vitolina

texts.en: Vitolina has been a member of Sagafili Mulifanua Center for a long time. She is the secretary of the Center and she is one of the most honest and faithful members of the Center. Vitolina is on her fifth loan and she is doing well with payments. Vitolina grows taro and bananas on her farm, which covers about four acres of land. She goes to the market three days a week where she can earn about 150 Tala (US$ 60) per day. She hopes to grow this business which is why she is applying for this loan to upgrade her equipment.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and tools for her farm and also for renovating her house

loans.name: Guleyda

texts.en: Guleyda was born in 1961and lives in Khachmaz town in Azerbaijan. Guleyda is a mother of 2 children. She has baking bread for 3 years. Now she needs a loan of $425 to buy  flour and additional products for baking bread to sell.

loans.use: To buy flour and other products for baking bread

loans.name: Arif

texts.en: Arif M. is a taxicab driver in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Arif is married with three children and has been working as a taxi driver for the last three years. He is currently looking for funding so that he can make some much needed repairs to his taxicab.

loans.use: To make repairs to his taxicab

loans.name: Liz Orfita

texts.es:
Liz is a member of the communal bank Loreto, located in the Jr. Comandante Suárez No. 344, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Liz is 26 years old and is the mother of 1 child. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, in the amount of S/300, she invested in the retail sale of groceries. With a lot of hard work she was able to set up a small store and thanks to the loans she has received from Manuela Ramos she is able to stock it with a variety of products used in everyday life.

The S/3,000 loan, that she will pay in 5 months, will be used to purchase 2 sacks of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 2 boxes of milk, 2 boxes of sodas, 1 box of cooking oil, etc.

At the beginning, Liz had a lot of doubts about earning a living selling groceries, but with time and the support she received from Manuela Ramos, she realized that her business was starting to be successful. With her husband's support Liz hopes to continue to grow not only as a woman but as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

señora Liz pertenece al banco comunal Loreto, ubicado en el Jr. Comandante Suárez N° 344, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Liz tiene 26 años y es madre de 1 hijo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 decidió invertir en la venta de abarrotes al por menor.
